[8/8/17, 9:14:21 PM] HFRyan ARROW: Pslams 69:4
4 They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of mine head: they that would destroy me, being mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty: *then I restored that which I took not away.*



Hey guys I was just listening to this amazing sermon by Pastor Prince 2-3 weeks ago and he talked about how God's miracle working power(Dunamis) is made perfect in our weaknesses. And then he goes on to Psalms 69 which is a *Messianic psalm, in other words a psalm about Jesus*. And here in verse 4, it says that *Jesus restored what he did not take away.*

And I was thinking yeah, wow thats amazing, Jesus came to restore to us what other people had taken away from us and with accordance to the Jewish law, a 120%! And thats amazing like whatever wrong someone has done to us right? *Like we don't need to look to the culprit for payback anymore*. If a person has slandered you, Jesus takes his place to restore you. If someone has hurt you, emotionally or physically, *Jesus has taken the person's place to restore you*. Because Jesus came to restore what He did not take away!

And then I thought about my own weaknesses, my own fears, my own insecurities and *I just realised that this didn't just extend to people who hurt me. This also includes the things I have robbed myself of*. Maybe my own fear has caused me much anxiety and needless thoughts, Jesus is here to restore peace at a 120% to a worry He did not cause. Maybe that anxiety has caused me to overthink and destroy or negatively affect some of my relationships, Jesus restores a 120% of what the anxiety, caused by my own fear, has taken away. And I was like wow....

Truly His strength is made Perfect in my weakness man.

[12/8/17, 12:23:57 PM] Loocurse ARROW: What should a CG be like? 

PEEL

*Purposeful*

Some kind of objective at the end of the CG. Be intentional even if it's rubbish

*Edifying*

Not just hanging out. Try to include word or encouragement. 

*Engaging*

This is youth ministry, not Chinese ministry... 

*Love*

Let everything you do be done in love by first receiving the love that Jesus gave us.
[12/8/17, 12:25:34 PM] Loocurse ARROW: 3 questions to find out what to share. 

1. What are you feeding on? 

2. What are your youths going through? 

3. What is the vision for the CG?

[1/9/17, 5:04:56 PM] Kylie ARROW : But when Sanballat, Tobiah, and Geshem the Arab heard of our plan, they scoffed contemptuously. “What are you doing? Are you rebelling against the king?” they asked.
- Nehemiah 2:19

Hello a little late but gna share what stuck with me from our bible study sesh on weds cos this was literally what just encouraged me as I was planning for a project for one of my modules.

So in this verse it shows how the enemies looked down on Nehemiah and even questioned his intentions when Nehemiah shared about the vision that was put on his heart to rebuild the walls of Jerusalem. 

The enemy will question your motives and intentions in ministry or even when you just want to do something good e.g.
"Are you just engaging your youths just to boost your ego/prove that you are a gr8 leader"
"Are you just doing spending more time with them so that they will like you more"
"Are you kissing up to the tutor so that you'll get better grades?"
etc
etc
LIES
LIESSSS
LIEESSSSSS

so ya the verse was encouraging for me cos sometimes we second guess our own intentions and that holds us back from acting on what the Lord may moved in our hearts to do. so yaaaas don't be fooled by his liessss. LIEESSS.

[16/9/17, 10:53:01 PM] Kylie ARROW : *What was good*
- Worship was good - partly cos of synergy also since they're a couple.
- Setting the atmosphere/pace at the start with prayer really made a positive difference (remember we were talking about how one of the cluster sesh we had when worship fell short because they caught on the fast pace at the the start and it affected them? This time round when lu prayed it was good and worship was good)

*What can be improved*
- CGM (tbh I couldn't buy in to the tithing emotion/time thing cos of the strict definition of tithing from the bible, it rly felt like a stretch for me so prepping the sharing & breakout was quite difficult BUT OK I SHOULD HAVE CLARIFIED EARLIER ALSO. In the end if you look at it from firstfruirs perspective ok then I can understand) 
- Keeping to time (on my part for sharing)
- Lyrics slides. Our room is a weird room so no matter where the worship team stands part of the screen will still be blocked but still it would be better for the lyrics to be like 2-3 lines at the top of the screen rather than in the middle, song title no need so big on top also mb can put at the corner.
- Comms as a team about breakout. Think we need to learn to voice out and clarify if we are not clear about anything if not like today some people prepped the breakout to explain tithing again which abel covered in his sharing. So if we weren't clear it would have been good to voice out.
- Sharing slides/verses could have been sent to the entire group so every one would know what would be covered in the sharing but it's also on our part to prep earlier also la heh 🙈

*Personal takeaway*
- I finally understand the principle of committing your first fruits in terms of emotions/time to the Lord lel. Using the word tithe rly confused me cos of how the bible strictly defines tithe. 
- this team has come rly far ???!?!?! would never have dreamt for cluster to run like that 2 years ago?

[19/9/17, 10:24:24 AM] Kim Lim: What was good?
Overall: we were super on time!!!
Breakout: core youths helmed the whole sharing session and made the j1s share as well. Some of them were also active in asking questions. 

What could have been improved?
Abit more time for breakout (to pray for each other, life update)

What was your take away?
Being bold in starting the ball rolling and not feeling awkward during facilitation. And that there's more to tithing, other than tithing money. Learning what are some of the practical ways to tithe my emotions and time was also a new insight.
[19/9/17, 10:31:30 AM] Loocurse ARROW: What was good?
Overall flow was good. I felt splitting up the sharing into two bits especially for a topic like this made things flow better.

What could be better?
Time management. Time overan for worship and breakouts which affected Abels sharing. We can work on dis :))

Take away
DELEGATE if you're holding an important role lol and if possible delegate to youths
[19/9/17, 10:40:32 AM] Abel Khoo: Any more besides rachel lee?

[19/9/17, 10:52:04 AM] Kai Jie ARROW: What was good:
- Worship and the transition between songs
- Sharing by Abel and Kylie are engaging
- Breakout size is cosy
- Exhortation and 

What could be better:
- Communication, the speaker introducing the breakout should explicitly say what time to gather
- Maybe we could have an MC like person that can help with the coordination of the change between events
- The CGM is a little confusing for the youths

Personal Takeaway:
- The idea of tithing the friendship
- Facilitation was a fantastic experience, facilitators should really visualize how they would run the facilitation

[21/9/17, 10:50:09 AM] Berwin ARROW: Anyway, I meditated on Pro 27:17. And tried to look up the meaning of sharpen (chadad in Hebrew) and it's context in the bible but it didn't really help haha. 

Then the Lord asked me to go figure out if a sword/knife can sharpen another knife. And I was like "ya can what why not right?", but just to be sure I googled. And guess what, the answer is a resounding NO hahaha. 

A knife can only be sharpened by something harder than it. When 2 knives are used to hone each other both will become duller and damage each other. Because the material of both knives aren't meant for this purpose. That's why we need a honing steel.

And it was like the Lord speaking to me! We can look up the root of man and friend inside the verse which states that we are weak in nature, very much like the knife iron. Sharpening the countenance of a friend with our own human/worldly words will probably do more harm than help our friend. It is through His aid (our honing steel) that we can truly sharpen the countenance of our friend. That the words that come out of our mouth are in line with His ways and love for us. 

Also sort of spoke to me that the weapon He has given us and sharpened for us is not meant to be used against our friends but against the enemy. And that the more we use the honing steel, the more we dwell in His presence and Word, the more we know how to teach it to our friends that they may use it, and spread this to more people as well!

I rarely have such revelations like these haha, so really PTL!

2. my facilitation ended early and I was kinda worried that we would've had awkward convos but my entire group just facilitated itself and the end and they ended up sharing with each other on how they can handle the practical tips :'-)

[19/10/17, 11:01:21 PM] HFRyan ARROW: Emphasis in breakout:
(X) Preaching
Application
Practical help

Teach the youths how to Bible Study
- How to bring the story alive and establish what you can receive from the story.
- How to make it practical(How to have great faith):
Both had impossible situation.
Both asked the Lord.
Both are under gentiles and never knew the Law.

We are the same as these people, we are gentiles, we have our impossible situations, today why dont we just share what is one impossible situation we have today <this is the inward - in what area we can exercise our small faith (This is the being loved by the Lord part)

Outward - meaning? What are the things that are in your hearts? To do? The things that you feel you have too little faith to do. (This is the live loving part)

This sharing you can remember and help follow up later on.

[29/10/17, 1:09:54 AM] Kylie ARROW : my day was just ok i think all the good things and bad things cancelled each other out lol. i was listening to the same sermon twice the whole day today but i don't feel like anything sunk in cos in that sermon pastor showed a lot of iillustrations so it was a bit difficult to follow the audio sermon. ok but i still did go find other ways to just feed myself - i read a rly nice devotional from some bible app. but anw i rly felt like i just had the whole day to myself and Jesus cos both my brother and my mom are out doing their own thing so my mom told me to cook my own dinner tonight, she said there was some raw chicken that she asked me to finish up so ok. i rly wanted to eat creamy pasta and so i googled and the recipe looked easy enough but then after i cooked the chicken and my mushrooms cos i was too lazy to take them out from the pan i thought i could just make the sauce and everything in the same pan but NO the stupid flour stick to the chicken instead of the butter and DINNER WAS RUINED and the pan took a long time to clean and i was so frustrated and i still had the cooked pasta sitting in the pot and i rly just wanted to throw it away everything and not eat cos i was so frustrated at how i wasted my time like omg i was rly rly rly RLYYY frustrated so i complained to God out loud since i was the only one at home "omg i just wasted so  much time kjashdflksajhdfklahsj" and then when i was done cleaning up i had half a mind to throw away the cooked pasta alrd then i just felt like God was saying "try again" and that made me even more frustrated cos TRY FOR WHAT kjsahldflkhjs then after staring at the pasta for a while i thought FINE GOD I WILL TRY AGAIN JUST BECAUSE YOU SAID SO and so i did try again to make the cream sauce and omg it all worked out!!!!!!
[29/10/17, 1:10:00 AM] Kylie ARROW : so in the end i had creamy mushroom pasta wo the chicken
[29/10/17, 1:10:05 AM] Kylie ARROW : and it didn't take up too much time
[29/10/17, 1:10:10 AM] Kylie ARROW : then i realised even though in my head i thought GOD I AM COOKING FOR YOU I AM COOKING AGAIN JUST BECAUSE YOU TOLD ME TO but in reality i guess He was asking me to try again not for Him but for myself lol cos if not if i had just stopped there i would probably have been frustrated w myself through the night.
[29/10/17, 1:10:17 AM] Kylie ARROW : so that wholeeeee episode made me realise that God is a gracious God because He cares for such a small matter in my life lol like it's just cooking but in that one moment of failure cooking felt like the whole world to me lol

[29/10/17, 1:34:54 PM] Sherrie The Shepherd 🐑: Hi guys, so as mentioned yesterday, in addition to the survey on counselling (tinyurl.com/arrowhelps) which i know yall are faithful and diligent shepherds to do.... 😊🙃

We would like to differentiate the number of more critical cases for each CG over the past year (as described below). This is separate from the info collected on the link as the other information is being collected anonymously 😊

🔹Health (H): Serious physical and mental health cases, such as chronic sickness, incurable diseases, self harm, suicidal, hospitalization, death of close family member

🔹Addiction (A): Serious addictions, such as eating disorders, gaming addiction, drugs, smoking, sexual addictions (pornography) 

🔹Criminal (C): Police cases, stealing, borrowing money, gang fights, premarital sex for minors, boys/girls home

🔹Sexual (S): Sexual confusion, sexual abuse, heavy petting, premarital sex, molestation, rape, incest, unwanted pregnancy, abortion 
—————

*Please send me the info for your CG acc to these 2 categories:*

1) No. of HACS cases
2) No. of all other counselling cases

1 leader per CG to PM to me. Thanks all! 🙆🏻
(Link for counselling survey: tinyurl.com/arrowhelps)

My group had to personally collect it from him today.

He wants to work with us on our paper to submit for a conference in New York that is happening next year and this conference has all the professors, practitioners and PhD students and it is by-invitation only based on whether the conference accepts our paper. But omg hehe I am so excited I am more excited to work on this than FYP. So in the next couple of months the prof will be working tgt w us to improve on the work we have alrd done to submit the paper 😭👍🏼 and I’m gna be the lead author of the paper so it is gna be (Sng, Au, Lim & Pang, 2018)/(Sng et al., 2018) !!!!!!!!!!!

[13/12/17, 4:52:13 PM] Berwin ARROW: Hey guys was just reading Romans (spiritual gifts and loving practically) and this verse “cling to what is good” jumped out at me.

So I checked the blb for the Greek translation and I realised the more accurate word for it was “cleave”. And if you look in the blue letter bible it says “to join or fasten firmly together”. 

And it just reminded me of sth

- of how Jesus *cleaved* Himself, literally as the psalmist beautifully writes “I can count all my bones, They look and stare at me”. 

- He *fastened* himself to the cross, to die the most horrible deaths one can die

- divinity sealed Himself with the worst of men as He *joined* Himself to us, ““For we do not have a High Priest who cannot sympathize with our weaknesses, but was in all points tempted as we are, yet without sin.”
‭‭
Today we can love our youths practically (largeness of heart), to see the gold where others cannot (trust Him for discerning eyes), cling to the small things (not despise the days of small beginnings) _only because He first *cleaved*, *fastened*, *joined* Himself to us_ , loved us for who we are right here right now.

Blessed Christmas guys☺ love y’all

[16/12/17, 10:30:47 AM] Rachel Koh: *Directions!!!*

1. take exit C from Beauty World mrt station
2. take bus 41/ 77/173 and get off at the second stop
3. cross the zebra crossing!!
4. turn left and walk straight towards the "Goodluck Garden" sign
5. turn right, into the lane and walk towards the security guard post
6. walk right in (if the security guard asks where u going say function room!! otherwise just smile and walk normally HAHAHA)
7. follow the slope up winding leftwards until you see a cement pathway (on your left) near where the ground is levelling off
8. turn into the cement pathway and walk straight in you should see the pool
9. look across the pool and tADA!!!! you're the function room!!!! :-)

[5/1/18, 7:11:01 PM] Kylie ARROW : https://www.google.com.sg/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/technology/2018/jan/05/apple-mac-spectre-meltdown-iphone-ipad-hackers
[5/1/18, 7:11:05 PM] Kylie ARROW : Apple got bug ah?
[5/1/18, 7:11:31 PM] Kylie ARROW : ??? My devices are working fine
[5/1/18, 7:16:53 PM] Kai Jie ARROW: to put it simply there is a flaw affecting not just apple. There are three major chip manufacturers: Intel, AMD & ARM. And all three are affected including windows. 

The flaw in summary is that the part of the cpu whcih stores the password has low level encryption which would mean that if the OS of a computer (ie OSx and Windows) is not secure enough, any application can access that part of the cpu and retrieve all known passwords. So in order to prevent that there are two ways:

1) change the cpu = change the whole motherboard
2) strengthen the operating system to increase the security.

The latter is more feasible thus the urge to update the operating system. That being said, the speed will be slower across all devices. So not to worry, just update your software and when you change phone or device, hopefully by then the latest chips are all secured.

[22/1/18, 10:11:05 AM] Kai Jie ARROW: Hi guys!! I wanna share something today! And this is because something has really dropped in my heart after hearig ytd’s sermon. 

So recently reality struck me: i got work, relationships to invest in, ministry, my own walk with the Lord, coding self learning to manage and gym. And i realized that i am really hard pressed for time and spiralled into a mini state of confusion and lost. Then during ytd’s sermon, while pastor was preaching i began thinking of those stuff again. For some reason the Lord dropped in me this idea to memorize the book of proverbs (i know Abel already encouraged us to do so), and i felt like okay, sounds good but i want to know if its the Lord or if its just me making a “religion”. And so i asked God for grace to do so and show me from the word if that is His direction. Lo and behold today’s proverbs:

“Incline your ear and hear the words of the wise, And apply your heart to my knowledge; *For it is a pleasant thing if you keep them within you; Let them all be fixed upon your lips*,”
‭‭Proverbs‬ ‭22:17-18‬ ‭NKJV‬‬
http://bible.com/114/pro.22.17-18.nkjv

The last part got to me. So, i am gna try to memorize the book of proverbs and i would encouraged yall to have a revelation before doing so otherwise it is really challenging. So you can join Abel and myself now 😁 

P.S. we still need grace to memorize 31 chapters 😅

[24/1/18, 12:40:24 PM] Kylie ARROW : I don’t quite have a definition for what simple is but I’ve searched compared the difference between fools and simple before (because they appear in Proverbs a lot) and they are pretty different. From what I remember, the simple comes across to me as someone who is naive and a fool is someone who is arrogant in his own ways.
[24/1/18, 12:43:03 PM] Berwin ARROW: The Hebrew word for “*trust* (in the Lord)” is actually the same word for *foolishness* in the Hebrew. 

So when it says that The Lord preserves the _simple_, it actually means that He preserves the *foolish* one, that our faith in Him is actually almost foolish. That we trust in Him foolishly, that our trust in Him can be  foolish/ illogical, because His finished work at the cross was foolish/illogical/ reckless and relentless
[24/1/18, 12:44:19 PM] Berwin ARROW: Actually *foolish*, ignore the almost finish (it’s a typo) 

Hope it makes sense vans :) if not I’ll explain to you later again haha
[24/1/18, 12:50:19 PM] HFRyan ARROW: Its also the fact that the Lord saves the foolish. All of us without Christ could not get Godly wisdom coz we have no access to any of Gods riches. But yeah the Lord preserves and saves the foolish ah. If not we are all gone. 

But that doesnt mean we do not seek wisdom :) the Lord saves us in our foolishness but at the same time grows us in wisdom.

[14/2/18, 8:15:31 PM] Kylie ARROW : Hellooooo, it was my turn to share today on my VG chat so I thought to share w y’all too.

“Why are you in despair, O my soul?And why are you restless and disturbed within me? Hope in God and wait expectantly for Him, for I shall again praise Him, The help of my [sad] countenance and my God.”
‭‭PSALM‬ ‭43:5‬ ‭AMP‬‬

Idk about you but being a comms student (or mb just a millennial lol) I’m constantly plugged in to social media and it’s shocking to me sometimes how my life can be going just fine but when I open social media and see what others are up to, it makes me feel like I am lacking so much in my life. I start to feel so dissatisfied and that snowballs into a bunch of other nasty feelings.

I love how the verse reminds us that in moments where our feelings/despair/restlessness shocks us, we don’t have to settle for those feelings nor let them define us. Instead we can point our souls to God - our Hope and the anchor for our souls. ⚓

Watch how the psalmist does it

1⃣ He questions the source of that dissatisfaction.

_*Why* are you in despair, O my soul?_

👉🏼 it is OK to ask “WHY DO I FEEL LIKE THIS”. Because that’s when you’ll know what you’ve been letting into your soul that’s been brewing that distress. For me, it was the comparison from scrolling on Instagram la.

2⃣ He points his soul back to the Lord

_*Hope in God* and wait expectantly for Him._

👉🏼 LOOK 2 JESUS 👀👀👀👀 let the anchor for your life be the Lord and not your emotions nor the standard that society/social media sets.

[20/2/18, 10:40:02 PM] Loocurse ARROW: Hey guys, do yall know what the parable of the talents are all about? At first I went with the normal interpretation of "If you have a gift in xxx, then use it for His glory".

But I'm starting to realise that the parable of the talents is found after the parable the 10 virgins. The whole context is about the second coming of Christ.

The parable states that the one who buries the one talent he has is cast out into the outer darkness where there is weeping and gnashing of teeth.

So what does talents represent? (Matthew 25:14-30)

[15/3/18, 1:09:31 AM] Kylie ARROW : Oh just update for those who weren’t around regarding cluster

Rach will plan worship
Vans will handle logs/slides

Every one else read the cluster message and send in your map answers *by 10pm on Friday*.

The prog is basically

- intro to activity 
- activity in small groups
- wrap up activity and CR share
- CG in small groups
- worship & closing

At the activities portion get them to answer the activity questions and sketch a map on the mahjong paper to identify where in Israel the 4 different stories happened. This will be done in groups of 3-4 depending on your CG size & number of leaders.

At CG time you split back into the same groups of 3-4 and cover the portions in the CGM labeled as breakout 1 and breakout 2 in that time. 

For the portion on Good Friday it depends on what your youths say so it may go in any of these directions
1. According to the CGM lol
2. No friend to bring - challenge them to ask the Lord for one / live life bigger than themselves / why evangelism /
3. No friend to bring - bring irregular
4. Whatever other direction la it depends on the level your youths are at also lol

@6596931493 @6597529151 @6597836744 @6598712012

[30/3/18, 1:09:28 PM] Tierney SOUTH CJ: Cluster Feedback

Activity
- Message was a bit shallow. Could go deeper.
- Sense of community was there. Youths could be vulnerable with each other.
- Activity is more suitable for a longer period of time, given the amount of context needed to be known. So youths can glean more. Leaders already took quite a bit of time to prepare. Perhaps each group can focus on one story.
- Some youths did the activity just for the sake of doing it. It didn’t evoke any emotions in them. Maybe there was a lack of link between the activity and the message. Maybe the activity is not applicable in their life? 
- People can be left out in these kinds of activities. If youths are late, it’s hard to follow and process what the group is doing. 
- Maybe some prep is needed before CG to allow the activity to be more effective.
- Maybe the activity is better conducted in CG instead of cluster
Breakout
- Good because of real-ness in sharing (breakout #1) 
- Difficult to bring someone bc no one in mind; conversational topic go off (breakout #2) ——> but it’s okay, let life flow!! as long as the conversation doesn’t go toooo off, if it does then can jus bring it back
- Helped that there was a J2 there. It helped the J1s to open up. But it was hard to share deeply, it was quite brief/superficial. “O levels was my toughest point in life”. 
- It was a difficult environment for them to be real. They weren’t close enough to be willing to share the deep issues in their lives. 
- If there is one youth is willing to share more, we can talk more about that in the breakout, then the other youths can also catch/glean from that conversation. 
- Can do yes/no questions.
- Maybe not enough time to cover the 2nd question if someone cries. 
- Too big group = not enough time to cover breakout #2
- If breakout questions don’t prompt life-flowing-discussions, then open up a new qn that will facilitate more talking e.g. “so what does the lost, last and least mean to you?”
- Good that could pray for each other at the end of breakout
Worship
- First two songs good
- Worship at the start and end
- Prep the worship team to equip them = comes with time and building connections
- Communication to the youths serving is important; operational VS pastoral
General
- Try not to go over time but also be able to flow

Hi leaders!!! Thanks for patiently awaiting the CG direction for this week :) 

This week, CG is on *Jesus as our good shepherd* 😊😊
Main takeaway: _*Jesus is my shepherd, and I am taken care of. I am not alone.*_

Shepherd and sheep - it’s one of the depictions of our rs with Him that Jesus expounded on the most during His time on earth :) and to me it’s one of the most foundational things to us as believers :)

Also, seeing how it’s the week after evangelistic service and we wanna encourage our youths to invite back their friends whom they brought for service! It’s easy to digest, relatively low-barrier for NCs or NBs
[2/4/18, 7:38:02 PM] Sherrie The Shepherd 🐑: *NOTE: this is the GENERAL direction, so you can choose the passages/facil questions/sharing, but for those who are NOT SURE, I will be suggesting possible directions and send smth more comprehensive later tonight :)*

Possible directions:
- How the Lord takes care of us (Psalm 23)
- Jesus as the GOOD shepherd (John 10:1-18, contrasted w the hireling)
- Hearing God in our lives (becuSe we are His sheep - John 10:27-28) 

Possible ending: although Jesus was our shepherd, He ended up being the sacrificial LAMB as our sin offering. Literally taking our place in this relationship. He knows what we go through and most of all, He took our sins so that we can take His place of blessedness.

For more details:
www.police.gov.sg/news-and-publications/media-releases/20180606_others_Declaration_of_the_summit

In view of this, we will be shifting our departure from ~Harbourfront Cruise Centre~ to 
*BIG BOX (1 VENTURE AVENUE, SINGAPORE 608521).* 👈🏼❗❗❗❗❗❗❗❗❗❗

Meeting times and departure times *will remain the same*. The arrival venue for our return trip from Sunway to Singapore *remains at Harbourfront Cruise Centre* and estimated arrival times remain as stated in your briefing notes! 😉

Will send to y’all an updated doc after camp comm sends it through to better understand the changes in the departure procedure with details on how to get there. 😎

Send a 💃🏻 when you’ve noted this!

[21/7/18, 12:17:42 AM] Sherrie The Shepherd 🐑: Anyway, random but this verse spoke to me:

“Brethren, do not be children in understanding;
however, in malice be babes, but in understanding be mature.”
‭‭I Corinthians‬ ‭14:20‬ 

The Bible calls us to be babies in malice, but to be mature in understanding!!

I don’t rly have an exposition on it LOL but it just speaks to me. and I’m amazed that it was my first time ever seeing this verse this past week

(This is after paul’s rather long exposition on why interpretation of tongues and understanding (which produces prophecies) is preferable to only speaking in tongues.)

[22/7/18, 12:12:35 AM] Sherrie The Shepherd 🐑: I saw from my friend’s insta story that Taya Smith (newly married 😄) had a panel/sharing on relationships recently!! It was at Unplugged (Hillsong young adults service on fri nights). hahaha I asked my friend to send me her notes!!

Here they are:

God has to be the centre of your relationship or marriage - this is non-negotiable

Submission test:
- Sacrifice your needs - put their needs (the person you wish to pursue) above yours and see if that person submits back
- submission doesn’t have to mean one party is more superior than the other. Equal submission fosters respect and trust 
- If they are abusing this submission test then they aren't the one

Dating/marriage:
- Respect each other's time for God 
- Motivate each other to grow more
- Don't let your feelings get the best of you
- Guard your heart (proverbs 3:4)

Single:
- Hold on to the promise that God has for you, don’t hold on to an ideal 
- Ask God for a promise regarding your future spouse
- Psalms 15-16
- Trust the season you are in
- Feelings aren't facts
- You might feel frustration but don't miss out on what God is doing in your life when you are single
- Don't ever settle for the second best
- The right person can't come in when the wrong person is in your life

Past:
- If you have dated other people before and have done things that make you think you've gone too far, just know that by the grace of God you can be redeemed
- Don't cut yourself out from God
- We serve a God of freedom and truth. Be real and vulnerable with Him
- The word of God brings life, fullness, restoration, healing

So don't live as per what the media would tell you to do. You live your best and to the fullest when you live as per god's word

Ambs batch 5 is coming to a close and so we will be starting the process for the nomination of the next batch of Service Ambassadors ✨⚡✨ 

(On a side note, thank you so much for sending your youths to ambs for the last 2.5 years! They’ve been such a blessing to the ministry!)

We would need the submission of names latest by *9th September*! The following will be a rough guide and reminder of what Service Ambassadors are about and hopefully this will help!

🍭 an ambassador is *a point of connection*, the first face your NB/NC meets
🍿 an ambassador represents your cluster (hence they should be regular and connected with the CG)
🍰 Commitment level: *every service for 6 months* (starting from 29th Sept)

Much appreciatez to have their names, NRIC, and phone number sent in (to this number) by *9th September*!! 

_Number of Ambs needed per cluster_
JC South(3)

[5/9/18, 2:43:52 PM] Sherrie The Shepherd 🐑: Hi leaders \😊/ Megan asked me about POST-RALLY and I thought I’d share here as well!

_*“Now that rally is over, what do I do?”*_

1/ first off, just wanna say THANK YOU for serving! And next, *every life is precious!!!*

2/ the keyword is *FOLLOW-UP*. You can:
• Ask youths who brought friends: how was rally for them and their friends?
• If you managed to connect with their friends and they’re comfortable sharing, you can also ask them yourself!

3/ if your youths’ friends are New Believers,
• Woohoooo!! 🎉 Talk to them and your youths about where they’re at, how they feel about the decision, any concerns/worries?
• *Invite them back to join us!!! 😊 #Southisfamily*

4/ if your youths’ friends were visiting from another church,
• If they are rooted in their home church, the door is open for them to visit anytime, But we generally won’t heavily encourage them to come again (lest we be seen as sheep stealers 😛)
• If they are not rooted in any church, *Invite them back to join us!!! 😊 #Southisfamily*

5/ again, *every life is precious!!!* and it really forms the basis of why we do what we do. hopefully the above is useful and practical? Wanna encourage you guys to be *bold* and *diligent* to follow up 😊 and by doing this, you are carrying Jesus’ heart for them and for “the one”!! Thank you for serving!! 🔥❤

[13/9/18, 11:04:03 AM] Kai Jie ARROW: Hey guys, i just want to share my takeaways from Nehemiah 3😊, because i won't be present on the 15th of Sept. 

Admittedly Nehemiah 3 had been and will always be a boring chapter to me because it is just names and more names. And perhaps someone of Ps Prince’s calibre will be excited at the hidden meaning of names or how it all pieces together (like the lineage of Adam).

But yesterday’s reading opportunity allowed Jesus to open up my eyes and see👀 beyond just name and more names and really apply it to the ministry. So, here goes:

So the chapter begins naming people from different backgrounds. They were leaders, sons of sons of sons of some random person, the priests and also family units. Also, there were people who weren’t skilled in constructions helping out as well. There were goldsmiths, merchants and perfumers...etc.  So first we have it, no matter the background nor experience, there is a part that we can all play in Arrow. Next, I read that not everyone just built walls. They built doors, towers, stairs…etc. Arrow cannot survive only on people who are standing on stage or cgls or those who are in ops running the weekly services. Arrow is what it is today because of the youths who have a far greater reach, an impact in their social circles; something that neither platform ministry nor the ops can reach out to.. And that is the beauty of it. What is the point of cgls if there are no youths. What is the point of the preacher/music ministry/ops if there are no audience/service to run. 

The one thing i noticed is the repetition of “and next to them” & “after him”. And that really seals it for me because we are in this together. we serve side by side. I am next to Lucas as much as Lucas is next to Kylie..and the chain goes on all the way to Ps Dan who is next to Ps Prince. Also “after him” spoke to me in the sense that we are not alone in our respective ministry. For example, Ryan and Rachel serve side by side in SA A. But with Ryan leaving, SA A still has Rachel. So in that sense, there is continuity? That the ministry will (and i pray) that it will never reach a point that there is just no continuity. 

The last thing that jumped out at me were ‘daughters’ being mentioned. Like the last NCC leader’s meeting one lady asked if there was a place for women in the ministry. Yes and a thousand times yes. Like in the house of God there is no gender discrimination. Women are as impt as the men are (our CR is female and the one heading the JC cluster is a female as well woohoo!🎉)

Of course what intrigued me is the way they describe the method of fixing the doors: “with its bolts and bars” 🔩which i am still pondering about. And also Lucas shared something about the order of the gates mentioned has a symbolic meaning to a Christian’s life (you can ask him cause i barely read it)

Hope my sharing wasn’t too long lol😅

[5/10/18, 2:14:25 PM] Megan ARROW: Hallo guys I checked the fastest way to get to Cherryloft Resorts without walking too much (cus this heat is so bad), hope this helps yall!! ☺

Nearest MRT: Pasir Ris MRT station
Take bus 354 from Pasir Ris Interchange
Alight at the 3rd bus stop (name of bus stop is Lighthouse)
Theres a small lane if you walk against traffic from the bus stop (Jalan Loyang Besar), just follow the lane in and Cherryloft Resorts is around the corner! The distance to walk isnt so far, its like walking across SMU Campus Green so shouldnt be so bad 🙂

[1/11/18, 7:05:37 PM] Sherrie The Shepherd 🐑: Wow just saw this and thought to share it with you guys ☺ following our recent fellowship over “compromise”!! So good! It is often so subtle, the posture and trust of our heart shifting from dependency on God to other natural things.

Encourage y’all to do the activity we left off with - which are the areas of your life do you think you’ve compromised on? Whether through fear, physical frustrations, convenience, or “I think I know better”. What are God’s actual promises for these areas? 😊

Let’s not settle for anything less than what God has for us 😄 I pray that there will never be a spirit of “status quo” amongst us but we will press in and inherit all He has promised us! Amen!

Adding on to the ❤ *IMPORTANT MESSAGE* ❤
 
As registration is starting very very soon, we need you to let us know if you have any youths under the allowable exceptions category for camp. This means he/she does not meet the attendance criteria due to the 4 categories below 🎅🏽🤶🏽

The criteria for allowable exceptions remains as the same 4 categories:
 🚑 Long term hospitalisation
 🏹 International competitions (ie represented Singapore)
 ✈️ Overseas attachment/exchange
 💂‍♂ NS commitments
 
Please fill up via this link by CHRISTMAS EVE🎄 thank you 😬😬😬
*(24 DEC 2018)*

https://forms.newcreation.org.sg/forms/arrowcamp2019AE/
[18/12/18, 6:25:40 PM] Sherrie The Shepherd 🐑: *FYI FOR FEMALE CGLs - NSF event*

Hey female south shepherds!! 👩🏻‍🌾 this is just to keep y’all updated on the event below 👇🏻 your NS guys have alr been informed by Tierney and Kaijie!

💂‍♂ *ARROW MEN IN THE HOUSE* 👮‍♂
Hey bros we are having a pre-enlistment sharing session, everyone enlisting between Jan and March 2019 this is for you! Current NS guys do come down and give advice + offer moral support to your juniors too!

🌟26 December, 2pm
🌟Cuppage Sapphire Room
🌟All Enlistees and NSFs/ORDed personnel invited

See you there! Come with your practical questions and understand God's purpose and His good plans for you in this season. Tbh you'll really be touched by the Lord and feel 100000x better about enlisting after this thing. And for those already serving/ORD-ed, your presence will make a big diff to your juniors too :) Come find community with your fellow enlistees and bros, look forward to seeing y'all! 

In brotherly love,
Ivan & Matt (JC NS Team)

[12/1/19, 12:47:57 AM] Megan ARROW: Hellu guys directions for tmr!! Meeting is at *SMU, SOE Seminar Room B1-2*

Coming from *Bras Basah MRT*:
1. Tap out at the exit that does not have the control station, only a bunch of top-up machines
2. Turn left and you’ll see an OCBC ATM and a couple of POSB/DBS ATMs, continue walking straight
3. Turn right once u hit the SMU compound, and walk up the slope
4. Continue walking straight all the way, following the path. You should pass by the gym (on your left), B3 (on your right), and the Bencoolen MRT (on your right)
5. Once you pass the Bencoolen MRT exit area, you’ll see 2 lifts up ahead which are near the fishtanks, turn right and then left and walk straight.
6.Look out for a small walkway on the left that is in between two circular walls of some sort, there will be 2 doors, we’ll be in SOE SR B1-2!

Coming from *Dhoby Ghaut MRT*:
1. Once you have reached SOTA, when you cross diagonally opposite, you should be on SMU School of Economics grounds
2. You’ll see an escalator inside this enclosed area (glass), take the escalator down
3. Turn left and walk past the first fishtank
4. Look out for a small walkway on the right that is in between two circular walls of some sort, there will be 2 doors, we’ll be in SOE SR B1-2!

[28/1/19, 12:18:54 AM] Sherrie The Shepherd 🐑: CG 2 FEB 2019

Objective(s):
• (1st objective by CGLs, depending on your CG topic)
• To welcome the freshies!

Options for CG topics:
1. Bible study on church theme of the year (Year of the Latter Rain)
2. Bible study on South cluster vision
3. Visioning (bible stories like Abraham; passages like Habakkuk, Ezekiel 37...)
4. Anything within Arrow’s 4 C’s (Christ, Culture, Community, Conqueror)

Pointers:
• Have some activity or program that can help break the ice betw seniors and freshies! 
• Definitely have breakout into smaller groups; if having any combined sharing (like by one leader to the whole SA/CJ, to keep it to 15 mins :) 

Reminders:
• Get the freshies’ names and contacts
• Invite them back for 9 Feb

I thought of typing out facilitation questions but those would rly depend on what your CG topic is... so I’ll leave that to y’all k, anyway y’all can already 😎

The main principle is to get them to share about their lives, and if it’s a bible study, to also have a qn on application! Eg how does this look like in my life?

[16/2/19, 1:46:37 PM] Megan ARROW: Hey guys, for those who are late/coming later, heres a bunch of directions for yall to get to Tanjong Beach on your own!!

1. From Harbourfront MRT, take the escalators up to H&M. Walk past H&M towards the atrium (H&M should be on your left and Tangs on your right), towards the exit of Vivo. Take the exit and walk out, you’ll see the boardwalk on your left.
2. Take the boardwalk all the way in
3. Once you reach the end, turn right and walk straight
4. Take the second last exit (there should be some restaurant there i think its a seafood place) and cross the bridge over the mini river, you should see the Food Street on your right.
5. Walk past Food Street and you’ll see Universal Studios on your left
6. Look for the monorail station, it should be right across from where you entered, so from Food Street, head towards the outlet thats ahead of you (you should walk past this fountain area after Universal Studios, the monorail station should be on the right)
7. Take the monorail to Beach Station (make sure you’re taking the right direction and not back to vivo hahah)
8. Once you alight at Beach Station, when you head down, you shld be exiting via the left
9. When you exit the monorail station, turn left again and you should see some shops, i know there’s a Gelato place and Old Chang Kee is there as well, you’ll also see some buses there
10. There should be a road on your left, cross over (can take the zebra crossing), and there shld be a tram station there (metal bars are there for the queue)
11. Take the tram to Tanjong Beach!!!
12. Once you have alighted at Tanjong Beach, walk away from the Tanjong Beach Club towards this grass area thats facing the sea, you should see us there near the Pavilion area!

[21/2/19, 3:16:03 PM] Kai Jie ARROW: “Then Jesus, looking at him, loved him, and said to him, “One thing you lack: Go your way, sell whatever you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, take up the cross, and follow Me.”” ‭‭Mark‬ ‭10:21‬ ‭NKJV‬‬

We know the story of Jesus and the rich young ruler. We know what the ruler asked and how Jesus replied. It ended with the young men walking away sad for he was a very rich man. 
As a reader, we would not know tone Jesus used to speak to the rich young ruler. Just imagine Jesus saying this: 
“One thing you lack: Go your way, sell whatever you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, take up the cross, and follow Me.”
Quite a tall order and can be really demanding from an observer’s perspective. But yet the Holy Spirit beautifully went to the extent of documenting the manner of how Jesus did it. The bible says that Jesus looking at him and  loved him. Why this matters so much because when we serve, in essence we gave up “something” to follow Him, (time, opportunities, energy). But yet when Jesus called for the ruler to follow him, he did it out of love. Jesus loved him. The ruler wasnt another spare human being for Jesus plan, Jesus love him! Jesus loves us, you and i.

Apart from that, it taught me a leadership principle of engaging youths. It is not just about what we say but the style on how we carry it out and what we feel on the inside. Jesus didnt have to look at the ruler, bible didnt have to explicitly mentioned that Jesus loved him (i am sure Jesus loved everyone, yet there was a special mention). I know we cant be like that right off the bat, but let’s pray for the Grace to be involved when we speak to the youths or in any case, just about anybody.

Just wanted to share something from my reading with you all 😊

[27/4/19, 5:23:26 PM] Megan ARROW: Directions to the BBQ venue:
1. Take Exit F from Serangoon MRT (the Circle line side)
2. When you come out, cross at the junction towards the HDB blocks
3. After crossing, turn left and then walk straight (you should be walking against traffic)
4. You can choose to walk past the bus stop and up the hill (the sheltered walkway) or walk along the HDB blocks
5. As you walk straight, just before the condo, turn right. If you took the sheltered walkway, you’ll need to take this orange stairs down and you’ll see this space + a badminton court. If you’re walking along the HDB blocks, turn right when you see the orange space.
6. As you walk towards the badminton courts, there should be a preschool on your right.
7. On the left of the badminton courts, there is a back gate.
8. *Call any of the leaders once you’re nearby and we’ll pick you guys up from the back gate!*

And I've been broken within a moment

---
Hey Arrow Grads! 🥳 We’re so excited to welcome you to V in July! Here’s how things look like for you after camp:

🎓 *29/30 JUN - ARROW GRAD CLUSTER*

🌃 *5 JUL - V NIGHT*
_*(Friday, 8pm @ Capitol Theatre)_*
Join us at your first VN! Your VG Leaders/Ambs will get in touch with you via text by then, so you’ll know who to look for at service 😁

🆓 *12 JUL - FREE WEEK*
If you’re gonna be at Hillsong Conference, have a smashin’ time 💥 and we’ll see you when you’re back 😉

🏖 *19-20 JUL - V INTEGRATION*
*_(Friday Noon to Saturday Noon)_*
This is a 2D1N chalet camp specially designed for you to hangout with your batchmates, VG Leaders and some seniors! Expect great convos, fooooood, and some fun in the sun ☀🌴😎
📝 Sign-up links should’ve been sent to you via your NOAH email! OR try this link: bit.ly/regvi19
⚠ *Sign-ups close 1 July!!*

If you have any questions, beep us on ASK.FM/NCCVARSITY or write in to us at varsity@newcreation.org.sg 😄

[19/6/19, 9:25:07 AM] Rox SOUTH: *JC Leaders Huddle *
* You are doing better than you think 
* Ride on what the Lord is doing - this generation is going to hunger for the things of God
* 2 Activities to do with CG over the next few days
- Decide what is their spiritual habit they want to adopt
- Teach them to prophesy from the word. Gather them to pair up - ask the Lord for a verse; which book should I open up - word for their friends. What we do is that we give them and cultivate a taste for the things of the Lord (Taste and see that the Lord is good!) the youths will walk out seeing what it’s like to experience the Lord.
‎[19/6/19, 9:28:39 AM] Rox SOUTH: ‎image omitted
[19/6/19, 9:28:57 AM] Rox SOUTH: Thanks guys for being so on time and responsive! Here’s the mini-CGM, u can build each activity into a different meal time/cg sesh:) 

*How do you want to involve the word (God) in your daily life?*

“My son, give attention to my words; Incline your ear to my sayings. *(Listen to the Word)*

Do not let them depart from your eyes;  *(Read the Word)*

Keep them in the midst of your heart; 
*(Meditate on the Word)*

For they are life to those who find them, And health to all their flesh. Keep your heart with all diligence, For out of it spring the issues of life.”
‭‭Proverbs‬ ‭4:20-23‬ ‭NKJV‬‬

*Activity 1:*
Form a spiritual habit of the word in your daily life

Before/After I (current habit), I will (spiritual habit) 

Eg. Before I brush my teeth, I will read Psalms 23 over myself.

*Activity 2*
 Pray in the spirit and ask the Lord for a book name, verse number or word. Then read the word and see how it resonates to you

*Activity 3*
Pair up with a friend, go into the word and trust the Lord to lead you to a word for your friend and share with them.

[20/6/19, 7:03:21 PM] Rox SOUTH: South Testimonies

Zenden J2 SAC 
* Camp was like a roller coaster. Reached subway, was disappointed before Camp started because he heard bad news about his grand dad
* Day 1 and Day 2 nothing spoke to him so he was angry and disappointed
* Told his leader Kai Jie 
* Was reminded how impt community was 
* Talked to Sherrie in the afternoon - you should have an open heart
* Men’s service about an open heart
* Alicia’s prayer - you think you know the Lord but there’s so much more He has for you and He is always with you. And circumstances doesn’t define me.

Felicia, SA 
* camp felt very mundane and dull - forced to be in His presence 
* This year, He met me through using me to speak to others 
* Prayed for others, and used to always hate it because it felt forced, and found out they were accurate 

Zoe, SA A
* first camp in church 
* Few months - felt like she lost herself, very dry, couldn’t find God 
* Didn’t like herself for not feeling excited 
* Prayed for strangers, such as a guy next to him, Lord gave her courage. 
* “god you are so good, you used me to help others” 

Erissa SA A 
* this season felt like a plateau to her - what can you show me that you have not shown me before 
* Vision for camp - warm and cozy / hugs and warm vibes 
* Didn’t know she was still affected by what happened in her family. 
* Heard the Lord calling her the baptism name Area- because you are not defined by your earthly Father. 
* Random girl prayed for her - that she is being hugged by God 
* Another camp expectation - struggling to worship - distracted by singing well. Learned that worship is really her and the Lord - in spirit and truth. Allowed her to enjoy worship for the first time in her life. 

Edward SA A 
* got distracted in school - hit an all time Low. 
* Did okay last year for exams cos he worked hard 
* But this year, had really bad grades, lowest in all his school life
* Tore his ACL and missed one week of school and missed the papers he had the most confidence in 
* Scored so Low, parents were called in to talk to VP , felt like it was a big humiliation 
* Felt like he was not chosen to be a Christian, doesn’t feel in touch with the Lord like his Friend Felicia 
* Ryan was a big part of his life last year, and missed him a lot. 
* Parents don’t know much of his life, doesn’t feel loved at home in the way he wants it to be 
* Didn’t tell his friends, kept everything inside, felt low.
* Rachel appealed for him for camp. Didn’t think he could go cos his parents would never pay for me. 
* Rachel passed him the money to go to camp 
* Believed that God gave up for him 
* First day - intimacy with God, touched him a bit, teared a little, didn’t wanna cry
* Second day - Lucas prayed for him - you are here for a reason cos God wants you - cried a lot. Felt embarrassed for crying 
* Calista prayed for him. Only knew each other for Two days. “Let down these walls of your emotions and you will be stronger” 
* Ryan found him and hugged him and talked to him at 1am and talked to him and reminded him that “he mattered” 

Calista SA A
* used to go to date very regularly 
* Feb to Mar was a very rough period for her - tough to accept her emotions
* Felt like no one knew her - how to be vulnerable? If she wasn’t positive or happy, didn’t want to give the impression of mental instability.
* Bad things happened to her family before camp 
* Entered camp with a huge burden and pain in her heart, first time she really desired for  breakthrough 
* Didn’t feel she would be comfortable telling people in cg her problems  
* Told Berwin about her situation, the words spoken were very accurate
* Pastor called for the fathering call; went to Debs - she was already crying. The words were comforting and accurate. 
* Night; another ministering session - Rachel prayed her - the word was more than 120% accurate in her life. Broke down again.
* Felt very thankful for the community here amidst all the doubts 
* Went to the Family one - open to problems and feelings despite being strangers - that’s when the Lord can come in to help him 
* Hurt her that people were going through so much but it was concealed. All the more when you turn to God, your burdens will be lifted up. If you don’t anticipate, how would you receive your portion? 

Shang CJ B 
* 1 month before camp- didn’t tell them he was going to church even though he’s been coming for 3 years
* Very close to his parents ever since getting into Arrow
* Parents are staunch buddhists
* Afraid of risking the relationship with his years of half truths. 
* Dad had a bad fall 
* Was difficult to see him aching had to buy food for his families over the three days and he pushed back telling them 
* Started blaming himself for his dad’s fault 
* Couldn’t do it, couldn’t tell his parents that he was at camp 
* Day 3 - Tierney asked him what’s his dream? His dream was to go with His parents at Star and eat at Awfully Chocolate. Felt like it was an impossible dream to him.
* Day 3 Worship - sang Glorious Ruins and cried a lot. Ps Dans exhortation about empty rooms really spoke to him and was something that he journaled before coming to camp. 
* 
Tim, CJ B 
* 4 months since he entered a high stress job
* Was very frustrated because he felt like he lost touch with God
* Wanted to come to camp as he took it as a holiday for his job 
* Came to camp with a bit of tension with Berwin because 
* At worship, was able to cry during worship his heart felt so  painful 
* Appreciated his leaders a lot more - Berwin and Tierney. Was very happy for Berwin to wipe his feet. Wiped his feet - cried even more, Berwin hugged him and cried even more so. 
* Very thankful for Tierney as he connects with him as a Friend. Grateful to cry together. 
* Thankful for Berwin who is always there for him.

HELLO FRIENDS  view of the nation-wide move to stop the unnecessary collection and use of NRIC details from September 2019, our church will be doing a church-wide exercise in the upcoming months to comply with the move. 🙃

Here's an overview of the timeline😊😊 
_(NOTE: 2 items requiring your action)_ : -

*B Y  2 8  J U N* [PLS ACTION☝🏻] - ensure all leaders and servers are properly tagged on NOAH 
_*(aka even your CG ambassadors, etc, are all properly tagged as they will receive an email on next point)*_

*1  J U L Y* - a memo will be emailed to all leaders and servers requesting that we update our NOAH profile. This is because we'll be using our mobile numbers for log-in instead.

*1 8  J U L Y* - a memo will be sent to the rest of the congregation regarding the above

*A U G U S T* - role out of new NOAH login

*B Y  1 6  A U G U S T* [FYNA ✌🏻] - securely remove (delete/shred) all datasets/documents/whatsapp text/forms/emails, etc. bearing NRIC

=======
_ICYMI..._
https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/singapore/organisations-collecting-nric-details-from-september-2019-10670148
=======

Thank u so much for working w us to comply w the laws of the land!!! 🙆🏻‍♀

Declaring that the Lord makes you the Head and not the tail, Above and not beneath. Tonight, you shall go to sleep well-rested knowing that you are well-able to take the land! For the horse is prepared for battle, but it is the Lord who gives the victory!!!🌈🌲⛈ No matter the feelings of lack, inadequacy or strife, Southies shall rest in the knowledge that the Lord is good and He reigns over all things. He shall supernaturally bring to mind all the answers, and His wisdom and favour shall set all your scripts apart. Your heavenly Abba is in control, and He is the hope that *never* disappoints! 🌞 His peace is unshakeable!!!

_Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in needs, in persecutions, in distresses, for Christ’s sake. For when I am weak, then I am strong._
2 Corinthians 12:9‭-‬10

🌟🥇 The battle is the Lord's!!🌟🥇 Take heart and sleep early tonight ❤ The Lord is with you!!
 
In Jesus' Name, AMEN 💎

[1/7/19, 10:17:16 PM] Megan ARROW: Hey guys, this is regarding the tagging/untagging of freshies on NOAH. I've done up a document with instructions, its in the Admin folder in our South folder, labelled 'Splitting of CG Freshies'. Do follow the instructions in that document, I think should give a good explanation and guidance. 🙂

Impt notes
1. For the leaders of A CGs (i.e. CJ A and SA A), please do not untag the freshies until the other CGs (B and C) have tagged their freshies, this is just in case there is any issue with the tagging, at least the freshie is still tagged to the A CG and we can refer back to the freshie’s details to do the tagging. For the B and C CGs, just let the leader of the A CG know when you’re done with the tagging, then the leader of the A CG can proceed with the untagging!
2. The start/end date should be *1 July 2019*!!

Anything yall unsure about can text me! 🙂 Will check in with yall again at the end of this week to see how the progress is!!

[6/7/19, 9:48:14 AM] Rox SOUTH: Thanks guys for being so on time and responsive! Here’s the mini-CGM, u can build each activity into a different meal time/cg sesh:) 

*How do you want to involve the word (God) in your daily life?*

“My son, give attention to my words; Incline your ear to my sayings. *(Listen to the Word)*

Do not let them depart from your eyes;  *(Read the Word)*

Keep them in the midst of your heart; 
*(Meditate on the Word)*

For they are life to those who find them, And health to all their flesh. Keep your heart with all diligence, For out of it spring the issues of life.”
‭‭Proverbs‬ ‭4:20-23‬ ‭NKJV‬‬

*Activity 1:*
Form a spiritual habit of the word in your daily life

Before/After I (current habit), I will (spiritual habit) 

Eg. Before I brush my teeth, I will read Psalms 23 over myself.

*Activity 2*
 Pray in the spirit and ask the Lord for a book name, verse number or word. Then read the word and see how it resonates to you

*Activity 3*
Pair up with a friend, go into the word and trust the Lord to lead you to a word for your friend and share with them.

[13/7/19, 2:44:06 PM] Loocurse ARROW: My impossible dream for the CG

Kaijie - serving with my girlfriend in ministry (whether staying here/zao), CG can come in and chip in about anything, cluster nothing

Lucas - Bringing more souls to Christ, didn't really have a heart for the people of the world previously, admin process of bringing them to church was tedious to him but now he knows that it's just about them meeting God. For his CG to grow spiritually, for them to know their calling and to walk it out (impossible to him cus they're so young). For the cluster to be onz about
 doing church tgt

Rach - for CG, catch the heart of serving, not to be caught up in the hype. For myself, to be less afraid of my own expectation, to get over the fear of men. For cluster, rawness - unafraid & unashamed to worship in abandonment.

Vans - super crazy outside of church that's unconventional but will reach many people, but bound by ethics. Not just serving inside church but outside church too. For CG, they rlly know Jesus for themselves. For cluster, less passive about cluster stuff, know each other and b strong tgt as South!!

Tierney - hear the Lords voice and go with it. For CG, see all the irregulars respond and see the reg youths be blessed to be a blessing. For cluster, unity.

Megan - finding a job I rlly love with gr8 company culture. for CG, grow a lot more and have their identity in Christ and be grounded in the Word. For certain youths, to step up. For cluster, unity. Stepping up to serve in cluster by catching the heart of serving.

Berwin - for CG, be the most loving caregroup in Arrow. Cluster, all in for the Lord and out does each other in love. A sphere of influence with no boundaries. For myself, see the dream that God has placed come to pass in my life. Counter culture

‎[25/7/19, 12:03:11 PM] Rox SOUTH: ‎video omitted

[25/7/19, 8:56:49 PM] Loocurse ARROW: Hey guys!! I wanna share a testimony!! 🙂🙂 Gna be a bit long...

So rewind back to NS, I had quite a scarring experience in my office job because the bosses were super hard and the politics was mad bad. Everyone was backstabbing and trashing each other. And I rlly didn't perform well there :( I always messed up easy stuff and I felt damn dumb. I went thru trusting the Lord that it'll be better but it never did and I wasn't rlly well liked by the department (rightfully so).

So I thought i could just leave it all behind in NS but it kept haunting me. Everytime I messed up something in school, I always feared that I'll be a lousy worker, someone who can't follow my boss instructions and gna be useless to my company. And I think it even spilled over to ministry sometimes.

So then this summer came and I embarked on this internship with lots of fears, but also with this rlly great verse.

But diligence is man’s precious possession.
Proverbs 12:27b

Ya so I rlly went in with the idea of giving my best at every small thing I do. If I make a genuine mistake, it's okay, but I just didn't wanna make any mistakes that I could avoid by checking it twice or whatever.

And PTLLL today my career coaches from school came down and he spoke of me (my colleagues were eavesdropping) super well. He said I was a "bright kid" LOL and when the career coach came to me, she said "wow with such appraisal from your boss I believe you're gonna go far" and for my strengths and areas to improve in, my boss gave 7 strengths and 1 area to improve in LOL.

Ya I think it's smt that would have been impossible if you told me would happen before this internship, but I'm so glad to see the hand of the Lord in this area of my life 🙆🏼‍♂🙆🏼‍♂

TLDR: Thought I would suck at my job, His word in my life reaped a harvest and my boss loves me now (he's tryna convert me to be a public servant rn actually)

    • met a first-timer youth
- The youths and servers really enjoyed it on both sides
- Having youths at the service venues brought a lot of joy and vibrancy to the main church

*Feedback*
- Moving forward suggestion: to have a youth connection point that focuses on reaching out to the youths at main, perhaps a once a month thing and not just only on special events
- Emphasise on how love attack is not just giving gifts, but the heart that you carry to love (and loving can = praying, talking etc.) 
- Have a better idea of the space that we can move around in
    • E.g, level 7 there were two connect points but we only went to one
- Operationally: would have been better to have a clearer timeline, if not things are very on the fly = a little messy; let’s also honour the youths’ time!!

[30/7/19, 1:39:17 PM] Loocurse ARROW: Hello Beloved Shepherds! 😁 The cluster worship team is currently looking at doing a recruitment, so we need your help to send us a list of youths in your CG who can either sing or play the piano/guitar/cajon (percussion). 🎤🎹🎸🥁🎼

This list should include all youths who are currently serving in your CG's worship team. 

In the list, please indicate their name, instrument and level of experience so that we get a better understanding of the worship manpower that our cluster is looking at! 

To describe their level of experience, you may use one of the below: 
1⃣ EE - extremely experienced 
• As a leader, you feel that he/she is currently ready to put up for cluster
2⃣ SE - slightly experienced 
• For now the youth is not ready yet, but you have the intention for him/her to be put up for cluster in the near future
3⃣ NE - not experienced 
• He/she is serving for CG, but you do not have the intention to put he/she up for cluster anytime soon

Do note that if you were to put EE, your youth does not have to be super zai or experienced! What we're looking out for is youths who have a heart for worship, and youths who you see that there is an anointing that flows when they worship ✨

Honestly, whoever the Lord impresses upon your heart to add to the list, even if they've never served for CG much (or at all), please add them to the list as well!! Just need to highlight it to us ☺ 

Do send me this list by ________. 

Thank you! 🐸

[26/8/19, 9:21:13 PM] Loocurse ARROW: @6592323502 TL;DR I prefer to have my youths have meaningful conversations about zone x with friends, and making the CG gather tgt as one would make it more difficult.
[26/8/19, 10:29:20 PM] Rox SOUTH: Hmmmm, I see where you are coming from, get ya on that! ☺ I am also for the idea of decentralised / smaller break out groups so that it is easier to talk 😊 

but why can’t your youths have meaningful conversations about the zone x experience in the same area? :) cos I’m also thinking it may be better if u can access them easier- u never know how the spirit will lead u to the group that He wants you to join! And it also allows everyone, even those who didn’t bring a friend, to be involved :) building community and talking about their zone x experience doesn’t have to happen on separate days. 

it can be more intentional in that way too - cos practically, it provides a different environment w an intentional group consisting of the Nbnc, person who invited them, and some cg people who want to be the nbnc friends and are leaning in to hear about their lives. This helps to establish the way for when they return - cos it’s much easier to come back when they have a widened circle + know more faces than the one that invited them. :) and it’s not so heavy for the person who invites the nbncs to anchor the conversation- cos they can organically talk about other things.

and these cg friends that they have made can also look out for them in school! 

Also, sometimes - when you are already friends before, you don’t rlly push for a different/ more intentional kind of interaction. So the new environment of different mixes of friends can help :)
[26/8/19, 10:29:56 PM] Rox SOUTH: Anw I hope I make sense I’m a bit sleepy cos I just finished a night seminar LOL. Mmm any questions, can call me? Goes out to anyone of y’all here too 🙆🏻☺

[28/9/19, 8:33:58 PM] Rachel Lee ARROW SA: yessssss

at the start of service ryan (already a youth) hadn’t confirmed if he was gonna bring his friend so when he came, i asked one of my core if ryan’s friend came and she said “yes his friend is here!!” so i was like wAH AWESOme okay tqJesus.

throughout service i kept feeling the Lord tell me to ask the NC if he received Christ after the service (which is v strange la bc i always feel v weird when i ask that qn esp since usually the answer i get is no lol) and i was like okay Jesus HHAHA. and during altar call i leaned to take a peek but he didn’t raise his hand so i thought “okay maybe not today hahahha”

after service ended, we gathered the cg to pray for the j1s and j2s for exams and the NB was beside me and i saw him raise his hands, then i thought “ohhh okay maybe he christian”

so after we prayed i just turned to him and said “hi you came with ryan today right?” and he said “hhahahaha oh yes!” then ryan popped up beside me too and i asked “oh how y’all know each other” etc and then i asked if they were staying for dinner or not and they said no they were gonna meet their mutual friends so i said oh okay cool see you again! at that moment, the Lord reminded me “ask him if he received Christ” and i was like......... ah okay Lord aiya at most he’ll say no lor. 

so i asked “btw did you say the prayer at the end of the service? the one to accept Jesus into your life” then the NB laugh laugh a bit then he nodded. and i was like WHAT. ryan was also shocked and he asked “eh whAT you said the prayer???” and the NB just kept laughing and he said “yea i just like look down and prayed lor and yea i receive i receive” then ryan and i were like “OMGGG EHHH welcome to the family broooo super awesome, welcome” then ryan told me that he wants to bring him to the welcome lounge and he told his friend “eh let’s go get the free stuff” HAHAHHA

hello beloved under-shepherds (LOL) rmb to pm me when you've uploaded your cgm / need an extension okay :) 

_Lamentations 3_
22 The steadfast love of the Lord never ceases;
    his mercies never come to an end;
23 they are new every morning;
    great is your faithfulness.
24 “The Lord is my portion,” says my soul,
    “therefore I will hope in him.”

[14/10/19, 3:43:08 PM] Rachel Lee ARROW SA: hi guys wanna share with y’all smthg cool that happened at the recent servicE

about three weeks back at CG worship night, i gave a word for anyone who hasnt received the gift of tongues and one of my freshies raised her hand. in that moment i was like “omg Jesus i did not think this through... what now” HHAHAHAHHA

anyways, the CG laid hands and prayed together and she told me that she believes that she received the gift but she didnt still didnt pray. so i said isokay then :,) but it was still always on my heart for her to be able to pray in tongues, yet there were a lot of thoughts and condemnation– is it i pray wrong?? or was it the wrong word?? 

i told a friend about it and she told me how praying in tongues isnt about receiving the gift (as much as the Bible calls it a gift), but it’s simply about receiving the Holy Spirit and allowing the Spirit to release His power. 

fast forward to last saturday at Arrow, i wanted to give a word to one of the youths but i couldnt find her. instead, at that moment, Debs gave the word to those who wanted to receive the gift of tongues and lo aND BEHOLD i realised that the freshie who hadnt been able to pray before was right in front of me!! so i tapped her shoulder and held her hands and i said “don’t be afraid, i’ll pray with you :,) just let the Holy Spirit takeover“ 

then Debs started praying too and i prayed and for the first time wah i really felt this weight rest on me and it was like pulsating and i just saw it flowing through to the youth. 😭 

amidst the loud music i leaned in  and soon after i heard her praying in tongues too and i was like oHMY JESUS HAHAHAHA SHE DID IT. WOW LORD dis amazing and i sobbled.

[16/10/19, 12:11:07 PM] Berwin ARROW: Ok hi everyone :-)

For the leaders facilitating breakout, what y’all can think about for the descriptions we are gonna give to to the youths is these:

1) for “what has marked your journey with the lord” don’t focus on the *style* you go to The Lord, but on the *experiences* you have gone through with The Lord// nothing wrong with putting down how you went to the Lord, but try to put down experiences so the youths can try and relate better 

2) for “current season”, once again more explanation is good, but you can also put down the way you go to The Lord

Key pointers:

- categorise your descriptions into
1) what has marked your journey 
2) what is your current season with

- the youths will pick the leaders they can relate the most to based on past/current season, but don’t worry the focus is not from the youths drawing from us, it’s only really to serve as a way to breakup the youths from their CGs, to serve cluster’s purpose for bonding 

- the breakout qsns will still be designed to draw out from the youths 
1) what their prayer life’s look like
2) for them to glean and encourage each other abt what a life of prayer looks like
3) unveil Jesus

Things that still need modifying 
- ldrs description (we can help each other out later tonight)
- breakout qsns
- youth to share for svc recap
- length of cluster (2.5 hrs too tight?)

[19/10/19, 8:56:28 PM] Naomi Shamitha ARROW SOUTH SA: leaders briefing 

kai jie - writing the prayers didnt know when to do it. execution wise not v good. good idea but the youths didnt know what to do with it. intro to the wall was brief. intentionally draw attention to it. 

welcome - cute with kieroy. managed it well, grabbed kieroy. goal for berwin to not be with him.

sermon recap - pretty clear atleast know the heart behind it. felt a bit long berwins recap rich. a lot going on. did great even without notes! 

breakout - very fresh. very different. the purpose was met. what can we do different from service and cg. administrative was good! make it more season specific - how we phrase it ref more to walk with the Lord. 

take note of girl boy mixture. calista only girl in the relationship group & ethan wong only boy in rachs group. 

too heavy overlap will there be confusion?? very distinct areas might be better. why overlap is okay if not too big. 

can do it maybe topical wise next time!! 

when we see jesus in his grace, He sees us in our faith. point them away from their flesh and uncomfortable feelings hear them out and minister to them - boy girl unavoidable 

holy comm - not about saying more for the sake of saying more that t mins is for you to step up. ask the Lord what do you want me to do in that 5 mins. the minister geta ministered to in the process of prepping. 

sharing - style of slides very uni style. lesser words. 

mikestand etc move away after practice so dont block the verses. 

worship - lifting up their hands!! leaders moved to the front for worship. 

exhortation - was great! MIRACLE! it was like a rap. rachel lee in the house. 

praying for one another. some youths still go together with who they already know. maybe give a number at the start a bit mechanical but works

what was rox heart? pray for someone that they didn't know OR not from cg it was still a win

in general - ops timing!! end by 4.55ish felt so bad for the decor team. look at the timing better. 

there was a spirit of expectancy which is what made cg different

[2/11/19, 11:25:45 AM] Rox SOUTH: Hello!! Wanna share sth that someone shared with me and rly blessed me. 

https://youtu.be/_OxiAenjaww

- sometimes we get caught up in our day-to-day frustrations, and ask where is the Lord in all this? 

- that even when we cannot see - He sees, and His ways are far above our own. Drawing a beautiful plan all our lives just to bless us and to show us the depth of His unending love for us. 

- if an earthly father could do this, what more our heavenly Father? 

- And it speaks to me alot cos I know I am walking through deep ends of unbelief... but hey!! in our unbelief (as He helps us w this), seeing Him in our lives, despite things being hard, the Lord sees this as we believing in Him already!! And He accounts this to us for righteousness!! & despite all the unbelief in His promises - He is still faithful and true. 

Have a blessed time w your youths SA / have a blessed rest CJ~ the lord is with you, you shall not fall to the ground :)

1. KJ (Fiancee is getting baptised 🥳)
[7/11/19, 12:05:30 AM] Rox SOUTH: Hey y’all!! I don’t know about how you all have been feeling about serving. But I for one have been feeling great resistance and a very natural sianness about cluster and just any serving meeting in general lol. So I’m just gonna share some good things that have been spoken to me w more faith than I definitely feel - but Darren shared w me that just like how Elijah prayed seven times and saw a little cloud the size of a hand, there is a place for us to repeat His promises, the things we have heard in our spirit over what we see in the natural. That it is completely unnatural to turn to the Lord but the cool part is - that it is not on us to turn to Him. 

So this we shall declare over us - that joy peace and rest and fruits of the spirit is our portion! That we get to see the Lord afresh and know Him so intimately in this time on Earth, in these tiny windows, to see Him stretch and expand our faith and to know in all fullness the depth of grace we receive and the love He has for us. I just declare against any Attack in believing that even as we have entered into a time of the spiritual w 22/22, our hearts shall be so strengthened and built up in the loveliness of the person of Jesus - that everything that is of the flesh shall now to His name. Every demand and feelings of being overwhelmed/ underwhelmed shall be so excited and in wonder by the supply and promises He has for us. That as we are loved, we are led. And I just thank u Jesus that you cause South to be set apart and unite us in the spirit!! That as You dwell in us, our hearts shall daily delight in your sweet presence. In Jesus name amen! 💖☺🌈

[16/11/19, 6:41:22 PM] Kai Jie ARROW: Worship cluster feedback

Intro: 
✅Keroy is bolder
Clearer instructions for gathering people together

Rox part:
✅Roxanne did not rely on script.
Slow down because you have more time. 

Slides:
Needs improvement. Design wise - Use canva

General:
The clock is not visible for worship leader, speaker so they cant keep on time. Get a digital countdown timer.
Need more ops people to handle lights.
Set of protocols to designate front/back light and curtain panels.
Get a youth to record each leader’s part

Visuals:
Prep youth to take care of unexpected cases (i.e. overrun - blank slide maybe)

Worship:
Sound adjustment - if michaela sings ask her to put the mic closer to her mouth. 

Rachlee:
✅Flow in the spirit

Berwin:
✅Sharing his life/ very real
Mindful of time.
Rearrange sharing: Verse - Personal story - Verse (recap) - End of Song
Dont touch & go on verses especially if you dont have enough time.

Holy Comm:
✅Getting youths to lead in own cg - more intimate. Also give them the opportunity to take ownership.

Davyn & David:
Make sure they get the right memo. Davyn’s style was sharing more than declaration/exhortation.
✅David’s part was good

Alter call:
Dont use the word “right”
Dont need to repeat word for word
One suggestion: talk to our youths about why we do it on cluster when there is no new believers. So that they can get our youths to invite friends to be saved.

Programme:
Plan with buffer: i.e. 450 end when ballroom ends 530

[17/12/19, 7:15:39 PM] Rox SOUTH: Hey leaders:) as you are aware *CAMP REGO 2020* processes have started! 

One really part of the process is identifying youths who need *financial assistance for camp*. If they don’t submit their forms *by the end of this week*, we won’t be able to consider them for financial aid.

*Please help make sure as many of our youths can go for camp as possible by:*
1) Doing a general check/shout out in the CG chat for them to PM you if they need the application form 
2) Check in on youths who you know have financial difficulties previously 

The forms & supporting documents should then be emailed/mailed directly to Broderick.sim@newcreation.org.sg 😊 thanks guys! ☀ 

The gracious admin maestro Broderick has extended the timeline as we noticed that the number of applicants is much lower than last year so please help us check in 🙌🏻

Whether you’ve been dreading the CNY season or looking forward to it,  I just wanna declare that you shall see restoration and greater glory in the things u find difficult to trust for - be it a family members salvation, or just peaceful and joyful interactions with your relatives! There shall be much forgiveness abounding in your hearts :) as the Lord soothes all wounds in your families! And there shall be so many Qarah moments of divine favour!! 🌈🌈 and I pray that the conversations shall edify!! 🙏😊 

Just wanted to share something that touched me: (1) my mum and I had an unusually deep and touching moment before she flew off to HK for CNY, and (2) I could invest into my dad and move past the disappointment to talk to him normally! so ya!! Trusting God with you all that you shall see breakthroughs and celebrating with you all 🙌💖 AND OF COURSE TO PROSPER WITH THE HONG BAOS HEHEH
