[7/2/20, 7:47:58 PM] Rox SOUTH: Dear Arrow Leaders! 🐑
Please note the following updates since we’re now at DORSCON Orange:

• *Services and CGs will proceed as planned* as there is no ban on mass gatherings
• *The same guidelines apply* - if someone who has been to China and/or is feeling unwell should not participate in activities. 
• *Temperature taking at CGs is not a must*, however, CGLs should conduct visual health checks, and to turn away those with respiratory symptoms such as cough or runny nose
• You are *encouraged to do mass prayers* rather than one-on-one ministering. 

Even as we exercise wisdom in keeping ourselves and our loved ones safe, let’s continue to partake of the Holy Communion and proclaim His promise of protection in Psalm 91 over ourselves, our families and those affected by this.
[7/2/20, 7:48:35 PM] Rox SOUTH: Please send the following message to your youths by tonight :) 

Hey Arrow Youths!

We can't wait to see u for POLITE / JC Svc tomorrow! 🎊🕺Here are some pointers: 

*1) LEAVE OF ABSENCE (LOA)*
✈️ If u visited Mainland China within the last 2 weeks and are on LOA from school, *pls PM your CGL* and take LOA from Arrow too. 

*2) NECESSARY PRECAUTIONS*
🤧 If you feel unwell or have any flu-like symptoms (fever, cough or runny nose, etc.), pls see a doctor. Stay home and rest till you're all well. We'll keep you in our prayers~

*3) HEALTH CHECKS @ Arrow*
🕙 Come earlier to facilitate the temperature checks! 
👨🏻‍⚕ Pls note that if you turn up with flu-like symptoms, we'll ask you to see a doctor and rest up at home. 

Let's exercise wisdom in this season while we continue to partake of the Holy Communion and declare Psalm 91 upon ourselves and families. 🙌🏻🙏🏻 His divine health and protection are our portion!!

Blessings,
Arrow

[10/2/20, 1:05:34 PM] Rox SOUTH: Hey everyone! Just wanted to be transparent and show you all Debs’ (thank u!!) input :) 

Thank you all for your concern and running with me despite the potential for changes! 

I have decided to *NOT* have a cluster event as I feel like there is still much fear and uncertainty wrt DORSCON, so we will *POSTPONE* and use another cg day when things look better for this bash! This does not mean that we forsake the assembly of the church, yes we rebuke the spirit of fear amen,  and we will gather for *CG*! 

Primarily, to armourbear the nation and the parents whom children we have been entrusted, and given that Higher Ed has cancelled events >50 (Although government guidelines for DORSCON is actually <1000), and inter-school competitions have been affected, I think it would be wiser to meet as CGs and trust the Lord that He is still forging the spirit of Unity!!

[14/2/20, 8:38:16 AM] Deborah Chia ARROW: Please send the following message to your youths before CG :) 

Hey Arrow Youths!

We can't wait to see u at Care Group this weekend! 🎊🕺Here are some pointers: 

*1) LEAVE OF ABSENCE (LOA)*
✈️ If u visited Mainland China within the last 2 weeks and are on LOA from school, *pls PM your CGL* and take LOA from Arrow too. 

*2) NECESSARY PRECAUTIONS*
🤧 If you feel unwell or have any flu-like symptoms (fever, cough or runny nose, etc.), pls see a doctor. Stay home and rest till you're all well. We'll keep you in our prayers~

*3) HEALTH CHECKS @ CG*
🕙 *Bring your personal thermometer!* We'll be taking temperature as a CG before we start! 
👨🏻‍⚕ Pls note that if you turn up with flu-like symptoms, we'll ask you to see a doctor and rest up at home. 

Let's exercise wisdom in this season while we continue to partake of the Holy Communion and declare Psalm 91 upon ourselves and families. 🙌🏻🙏🏻 His divine health and protection are our portion!!

Blessings,
Arrow

—— 
Hey Arrow Giant Slayers! As you receive your 'A' Levels results tomorrow, I want you to know that the entire Arrow is behind you, cheering and rooting for you. Love,
Pastor Daniel

[22/2/20, 12:11:00 PM] Rox SOUTH: ----
Hey Arrow Youths!

We can't wait to see u for POLITE / JC Svc tomorrow! 🎊🕺Here are some pointers: 

*1) LEAVE OF ABSENCE (LOA)*
✈️ If u visited Mainland China within the last 2 weeks and are on LOA from school, *pls PM your CGL* and take LOA from Arrow too. *If you have been or are on LOA please help us by filling up this form bit.ly/zone-loa-qo*

*2) NECESSARY PRECAUTIONS*
🤧 If you feel unwell or have any flu-like symptoms (fever, cough or runny nose, etc.), pls see a doctor. Stay home and rest till you're all well. We'll keep you in our prayers~

*3) HEALTH CHECKS @ Arrow*
🕙 Come earlier to facilitate the temperature checks! We have an upgraded temp screening system 🙌🏻
👨🏻‍⚕ Pls note that if you turn up with flu-like symptoms, we'll ask you to see a doctor and rest up at home. 

*We also have a letter fm Ps Dan 👊🏻for your parents regarding the measures that we are taking. Do share it with them in case they are wondering!* Let's exercise wisdom in this season while we continue to partake of the Holy Communion and declare Psalm 91 upon ourselves and families. 🙌🏻🙏🏻 His divine health and protection are our portion!!

Blessings,
Arrow

[24/2/20, 10:10:59 AM] Rox SOUTH: Thanks guys for your labour of love and investment in time :) 

I’ve been meditating on this verse that Debs (And Ber shared again) shared with us and I declare it over our coming week too! ❤🙆🏻

Amos 9:13-15 The Message (MSG)
 “Yes indeed, it won’t be long now.” God’s Decree.

“Things are going to happen so fast your head will swim, one thing fast on the heels of the other. You won’t be able to keep up. Everything will be happening at once—and *everywhere you look, blessings* ! Blessings like wine pouring off the mountains and hills. I’ll make everything right again for my people Israel:

“They’ll rebuild their ruined cities.
They’ll plant vineyards and drink good wine.
They’ll work their gardens and eat fresh vegetables.
And I’ll plant them, plant them on their own land.
They’ll never again be uprooted from the land I’ve given them.”
God, your God, says so.


This week, wherever we walk is promised land! Land that we did not toil or strive for, but land that has been freely given to us! ✌🥳 that when our hearts are overwhelmed, we will look up and see that the Lord is Lord over all our lives :) and His promise for us is one of Rest, a spirit filled and spirit led life! ✨❤

[24/2/20, 11:31:16 AM] Rox SOUTH: Hey Arrow Leaders!! 😊 The leaders of our younger brothers and sisters need some help as rooming buddies at DARE Legacy Camp this year (22-26 June)!!! 😁🐙

We would like to extend this invitation to *you AND youths whom you recommend*. This could be an opportunity to expose those who might be a good fit serving in DARE, with no obligations. For those of us already serving, it’s more to help lend support to the DARE team!! 😁😁 #OneZone 🏠 This is really a privilege we’re extending for some of us to get to go for 2 camps. 😄

Additionally, the cost of this camp will be covered for you if you take on the above serving capacity. We need all the help we can get so if y’all/your youths are able to serve in this capacity to bless the next generation, *do PM me* by Sun, 15 Mar. Official registration will follow only after. 

If u need more clarification, just PM me too 😊 thanks guys!! 😁

[27/2/20, 11:02:21 AM] Rox SOUTH: Hey Arrow Fam bam,

During this season of the COVID-19 situation, we want to exercise wisdom as a church and focus our efforts and energy on the church’s core activities. (_Such core activities include our Sunday services, youth services and care groups_). 🙇🏻‍♂🙇🏻‍♀

In light of this, non-critical meetings like leaders and servers’ meetings at all levels will be temporarily put on hold till end of May. We are currently exploring an online option for some of these meetings so watch this space! 🔥

The exception to the above is if the meeting is required to support the core activity of the church (e.g. worship practice for services, service ops prep, post service debrief etc.) Your O/CR/TR will work out the details with you. 

*NEW UPDATES ON OUR TRAVEL ADVISORY*

📍In line with the Ministry of Health’s advisory, *if you have travelled to Mainland China or Daegu and/or Cheongdo of the Republic of Korea* within the last two weeks, please refrain from attending any church services/activities for a period of 14 days from the date of return to Singapore.

📍*DARE/Arrow*: In an effort to take additional precaution with our children/youth/elderly, we'll be adopting the following approach for DARE & Arrow for overseas travel: *If you travelled to any country (incl. JB, for any duration of time) within the last 2 weeks, please refrain from attending any DARE/Arrow services/activities for a period of 14 days from the date of return to Singapore*.

Thank you for partnering with us in this even as we continue to pray and stand against COVID-19 situation, and ask for the Lord’s wisdom and guidance in all this.✨

I think something the lord has been bringing me on is a journey of rediscovering what His love and grace means! 
 
_1 John 4:11 No one has ever seen God; but if we love one another, God lives in us and his love is made complete in us. 13 This is how we know that we live in him and he in us: He has given us of his Spirit. _

And something I like to do as we close the last 10 day of 22/22 is to keep one another in His love and in each other’s prayers because it’s the most practical and spiritual thing we can do for each other :)

So in the next 10 days, after we spending time communing with the Lord, shall we also build up one another in prayer, and pray for ONE assigned person each day!!! :) it can be after 1 minute or 22 minutes of praying in the spirit- and we will all declare over here on this chat and say amen together 🙌💪🥰

[11/3/20, 10:46:02 AM] Rox SOUTH: feel free to declare over Rachel Koh too~ if u haven’t and u wanna!
[11/3/20, 11:04:44 AM] Rox SOUTH: 🌞🌞🌞🌞🌞🌞🌞
Also good morning pals!! Just wanted to share something that’s been on Ps Dan’s heart that he shared with the Overseers and it really ministered to me :”) and I pray it ministers to you too~

One of the things on Ps Dan’s heart (since the beginning of the year) is 🌟🌈The early church.

“42 And they continued steadfastly in the apostles’ doctrine and fellowship, in the breaking of bread, and in prayers. 43 Then fear came upon every soul, and many wonders and signs were done through the apostles. 44 Now all who believed were together, and had all things in common, 45 and sold their possessions and goods, and divided them among all, as anyone had need.
46 So continuing daily with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, they ate their food with gladness and simplicity of heart, 47 praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to the church daily those who were being saved.”
Acts 2:42-47 NKJV

We are coming back to do the things that the early church did! And we will see the same results. The 4 things that God gave the early church were one by one stolen by the enemy. 
 ⁃ Holy Communion: We are not using it as a symbol, this is not transubstantiation. We discern the body and the blood today.
 ⁃ Praying in the Spirit: Only came back in the 1900s. Asuza street revival.
 ⁃ And the rest were brought back.

The enemy saw that there was genuine love in the hearts in the early church for one another! They sold their possessions for one another! There was a lot of favour. If we look at the following scriptures, God began to move! God gave the spirit, God added 3000, God added to the church daily!

The Lord spoke to Ps Dan about these 4 things that All these 4 things are to be received!!! 
 ⁃ Holy comm is to be received. Doctrine is to be received. Friendship is received. Prayer is also to be received — not so much for us to do, but for the Lord to give to us. And when we receive, we will get a great great harvest.

Let us not neglect this daily receiving of the blessings that God has given the early church. It’s not a focus on growth. It’s a focus on the Lord! Let us focus on being together in one accord, and hence,  being blessed. ⚡️🌈🌟🌝🥳

as you prep for CG, may His love fill your days and your nights ❤️ let me know once it is up too~ so i can consecrate it in prayer and give y’all feedback 🥰

[13/3/20, 11:16:49 PM] Rox SOUTH: *TEMPORARY SUSPENSION OF SERVICES - JOIN US ONLINE*

Dear Zone Leaders,

In light of the recent national address by Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong and advisories issued by the authorities, the leadership of the church has decided to *temporarily suspend all our services* (English, Chinese, youth and children’s classes) for three weeks starting from this Sunday, 15 March 2020 to Saturday, 4 April 2020.

We are continuing to engage with the authorities to seek clarifications regarding the necessary precautions to be implemented for the safety and well-being of all of our members.

*Care group meetings will carry on as per normal for Arrow, Varsity and GenRev, unless advised otherwise.* 🤗 

*Online Services*
We invite you and your loved ones to join us online at www.newcreation.org.sg for our English and Mandarin services, and Rock Kidz children's lessons, to worship the Lord and receive from the Word during this time.

Here are more details on our online services and classes:

*English services* | 11.30am and 2.30pm

*Rock Kidz children lessons* |On demand from 8.30am

*Mandarin sermon* |On demand from 8.30am

Let’s continue to stand together in faith and pray Psalm 91 over ourselves, our families and our nation. We will see you online this Sunday and look forward to assembling together as church once again very soon!

For the latest updates, please visit www.newcreation.org.sg·

The no cg rule is not implemented hard and fast but be wise about the duration and it has to be clearly communicated that it is optional (best if it’s not initiated by the leaders) because we have communicated with parents previously that we’re focusing on core activities: Sunday Svc and caregroup. [18/3/20, 6:43:29 PM] Rox SOUTH: Dear Arrow Leaders 🌟🌟

*FYI*, here’s some comms that was sent to V and GR who have official cgs this weekend (unlike us) :) *it would apply to us as well if* you/your cg/your cluster leaders had planned *your own gatherings* this weekend 😊 we’re adopting such measures because we wanna protect our spaces and our flock! 🐑🐑 Thank you for being awesome shepherds:) 

*—— COMMS TO V&GR ——*
In light of an upcoming engagement session with Singapore’s COVID-19 multi-ministry task force and local church leaders this week, we will temporarily suspend all care group / life group meetings for the week of 15 March (Sunday) - 21 March (Saturday). 

This will allow us to have sufficient time for the engagement session with the relevant authorities to take place and for us to determine whether additional precautionary measures are required for care groups to continue in a safe manner. 

However, we will be taking our care groups online this Friday. Watch this space for more info, and we'll see you in cyberspace! 👩🏻‍🚀🚀⏳🌔💫

——
Please PM us if you have any questions 😊

[21/3/20, 9:28:31 PM] Rox SOUTH: Hey Nay :) just felt like the lord wanted to remind you that doing the same amount does not mean it will produce the same result, that He is bringing you on a journey of faith over feelings and a journey of increasing discernment to see what is formul and not rely on that but to depend on His Spirit, who teaches you all things, who fills you with the life of the Lord. And He is breaking every bondage with the things of the flesh and showing you how fun and what joy it is to not just shepherd His people but to be a consenting sheep first!!

As in John 10 says, “27 My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:

28 And I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand.” 

You are a sheep that knows the loving words of your Father, who frames your world. That in this year, you shall experience hearing afresh, hearing and believing the things He has written on your heart, words that call out the abundance and beauty He sees in you, words that create worlds in the God-given dreams and light they carry for you, for your household and for your spheres. In Jesus name amen! ❤️☺️
[21/3/20, 9:41:49 PM] Rox SOUTH: Hi Lu!!!

Declaring great peace and great grace and great grace abounds to you as the demands of school increases, you shall see the Lord work things out for you in so many unexpected ways! 

Saw the verse Nehemiah 2:18 for you; Then I told them of the hand of my God which was good upon me, as also the king’s words that he had spoken unto me. And they said, “Let us rise up and build.” So they strengthened their hands for this good work.

And felt like the Lord was reminding you again that amidst all the disrupted plans, His hand upon your life only deals best, good and great towards you. And he shall turn kingly favour on your side! and He shall also cause people to arise with you, as He builds you up in Spirit, in truth, in love, in grace, in word, in hope, in faith, in excellence that whatever u build on this side of heaven, carries the touch of the Lord :) He strengthens your heart and your frame and is renewing in you a peace that surpasses all understanding and a mind that is intertwined with His heart for you :”) in Jesus name amen!

[23/3/20, 2:37:20 PM] Rox SOUTH: 🥇💒 Door of Hope 💒🥇

Pastor talked about 'lechem' and how to feed on the Word is also to fight :") and how like God's economy- that all we need to do is to DWELL and to FEED in the green pastures of His Word (the promises of God) in a battle. In fact, we fight from the position of already partaking in the spoils of victory- the bigger the battle, the easier it is for our God. 😇 🥐 So, really wanna encourage you to spend time with the Lord in this season, and let Him overwrite every fear and frustration in your heart with His word. 

🏖Today's sermon excerpt is a short one!! 🏖: 🎇 "Don't Let the Enemy Steal This - Joseph Prince" (1:15) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dkkHOXKfNks 

🎆🎆Beloved, the enemy's attacks cannot get to you when you know you're loved by God. As it writes in Romans 5:5; our hope that does not disappoint emerges from the consciousness of the perfect Love of God :) He is our living hope!! 

Shalom shalom! Praying that His peace overwhelms every inch of your heart, as He floods every room of your heart with His love. 🐣🐣🥰

[24/3/20, 11:05:46 AM] Rox SOUTH: HELLO CAREGROUP LEADERS! 

This weekend! We will prototype a new way to do Caregroup! We’re calling in *CAREGROUP 2.42* and this is how it’ll look like!

*PART 1: (Fellowship & Communion)*
1. Gather your Caregroup in Digital Space! (Set Online Caregroup Culture)
2. Q1: How is your week (fire up the comment section - not everything has to be verbal~)
3. Partake of the Holy Communion together (Get a server/youth to do it!)
4. Worship (1-2 songs)

*PART 2: (Apostle Doctrine)*
1. Right after that, get them to mute themselves and direct them over to the unlisted youtube link to hear the short caregroup message! (We’ll be talking about PRAYING IN THE SPIRIT)
We will also send you the video in advance so you can watch it first!:) 

*PART 3: (Fellowship & Prayer)*
1. Jump back into the Digital Space, and talk about it! (Leaders get ready to answer the question first)
  • Have you experienced an extended time of praying in the spirit before? 
  • What stops you from praying in the spirit? / Why did you stop? 
  • What do you know about praying in the spirit? (Acts 1-2 Early Church, Romans 8, Jude 1, Ezekiel 47, Pro 15:4...) 
(even if it’s online!) 
>>> Take the next 10-22 mins to PRAY TOGETHER, encourage them not to multitask for that time and play a worship track if it helps
  • Share how the experience was for them 
2. Never end off the session with praying for each other!

[24/3/20, 1:02:47 PM] Megan ARROW: Helluu beloveds!! ☺️ For today’s sharing, I wanna share this worship song with you that I’ve been listening to, especially in the past 2 weeks :”) 

Cody Carnes - Run to the Father
https://youtu.be/HTHS4W1bPj8

As you listen to the song, you’ll see that the song talks about salvation but what I take away from it when I listen to it every time is the simple message: That in anything and everything, I can run to Him! As I am, with all the emotions Im feeling, with all the things in my life that may not seem to be going my way, I can run to Him as I am 🥺 What a heavenly Father we have 🥰

I love the chorus of the song so much, theres a line that goes ‘Im done with the hiding, No reason to wait’. Times when I have so many things on my plate, sometimes I’ll be like ‘No Lord, I can handle it first, its okay’ BUT your heavenly Father just wants you to let it all go and theres no reason to wait to do that. Dont shy away from Him, fall into His arms and allow Him to take over immediately 🥺 In everything you’re feeling during this time, whether its school that feels like a drag, anxious about unis acceptances or NS/work is getting to you, let our first response in all of this be running to our heavenly Father 😍

“Come to Me, all you who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.”
‭‭Matthew‬ ‭11:28‬ ‭NKJV‬‬

He loves you (yes, you!!) so much, and we can run to him again and again and again and again, no need to hide anything, because He’s going to pull you in close no matter what 🥺💖

Hope yall have been having a good week!! Anyways wanted to share w yall a verse from psalms 16:11 where it says

⚡️You will show me the path of life; In Your presence is fullness of joy; At Your right hand are pleasures forevermore.⚡️

So ye here’s a reminder that the Lord has given each of you an overflowing portion of joy!! Whatever season you’re in be it a valley or mountain or just a normal average day the Lord has poured into you an unexplainable, supernatural joy that does not come from circumstances but by His unfailing word!! And declaring too that all that you set out to do, your thoughts and feelings shall be pleasurable and this week you shall experience for yourself a life more abundantly!! 🌏💥

And wanted to encourage you to spend some time with your Abba too because all the blessings in this verse comes when we dwell in His presence!! Like what Ps Prince preached last sunday - position before promises 🔥 yeps so let’s remember that our position is in Christ and all these things shall be added onto us!! 🌈

Whoops have a blessed midweek everyone! Love yall ✨💕

[26/3/20, 10:46:09 AM] Vanessa: Blessed Thursday Southies! Here’s a prayer for everyone today. You know, when Jesus died, He willingly gave up everything for us, so that we might be able to receive wholly from Him. As u read this, remember whose you are. Y’all can speak the prayer out, there is power in speaking! 🙌🏻

Thank you Jesus that your word is truth and alive. Thank you Jesus that we can come boldly to the throne of grace to ask freely of all things. Today, I speak life into every dry bone, into every area of lack and strife. Lord, that these bones shall live, that we shall be filled with your spirit. Thank you Lord that your life covers us, that we are kept safe in you. Pleading the blood of Jesus to cover everyone and our families from head to toe, that we are kept safe from every disease and danger. Thank you Lord that we are loved and set apart by you. We believe and receive this. Thank you Jesus. Amen! 

Have a wonderful day ahead people! You are loved 🌈

Listen to this one, it’s 🔥

Prison Break 
25 About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the other prisoners were listening to them. 26 Suddenly there was such a violent earthquake that the foundations of the prison were shaken. At once all the prison doors flew open, and everyone’s chains came loose. 27 The jailer woke up, and when he saw the prison doors open, he drew his sword and was about to kill himself because he thought the prisoners had escaped. 28 But Paul shouted, “Don’t harm yourself! We are all here!” 29 The jailer called for lights, rushed in and fell trembling before Paul and Silas. 30 He then brought them out and asked, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?” 31 They replied, “Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved—you and your household.”

I pray that this week, amidst the many demands, the Lord shall enlarge our faith, to take and receive from His abundant provision :) that what feels like prison, the Lord is breaking so many chains! That we shall go out and lift His name high with our lives as testimonies and worship unto Him :) praying we will have much fun and much joy experiencing no one but Him kinda life :) and after the prison doors are open in this season... all shall come to know Christ. In Jesus name amen! 🌝⚡✨🌻🌲

[2/4/20, 12:08:26 AM] Berwin ARROW: guys is there a cgm for this week's online cG? :)
[2/4/20, 12:08:48 AM] Berwin ARROW: or is it just exodus 12 haha
[2/4/20, 12:11:02 AM] Rox SOUTH: HELLO CAREGROUP LEADERS! 

This week is a service week so we're continuing with *CAREGROUP 2.42* and this is how it’ll look like! (in case any of yall are wondering where's Caregroup 1.0, the numbers are referring to Acts 2:42 😲) *We are covering Holy Communion & elements of the Passover in light of upcoming Good Friday* Do take time to talk to your youths about it as well and encourage them to invite their friends:) Over 100k people have been tuning in (and a lot of them have been local) to our Sunday svcs, people need to hear the Good News of Jesus Christ!!! Time for #unprecedentedrevival

Here's a suggested flow for this week~ 

*PART 1: (Fellowship)* - 20 min 
1. Gather your Caregroup in Digital Space! (Set Online Caregroup Culture, appreciate them for prioritising time with the people of God)
_PROTIP: Set up a welcome slide EJ leaders pls share_~
2. Q1: What's something you asked God for this week _esp during 5/10 22_ (fire up the comment section - not everything has to be verbal~)
3. Worship (1-2 songs)

*PART 2: (Apostle's Doctrine)* - 20 min  + 15 min (video) 
1. Read Exodus 12 together! Discuss what they caught. 
2. Right after that, get them to mute themselves and direct them over to the unlisted youtube link to hear the short caregroup message! (We’ll be focusing on HOLY COMMUNION)
_PROTIP: Use Zoom to screen it and watch party together! They can even comment "amen" as they receive (the video is not for circulation 😁)_
_
*PART 3: (Communion & Prayer)* - 30 min
1. Jump back into Digital Space, and talk about it! 
  • Survey: How often do you take Holy Comm in a week? (pls take note of the answers so we can consolidate)
  • What was one thing they caught? 
  • The Passover was the shadow of the Cross to come. The Holy Communion is a reminder of the Jesus's finished work at the cross today. 
  • Encourage them to partake as often as they can & remind one another 
>>> Take Holy Comm together 
>>> Pray together for 10 mins then check in on Tele!!! (type their declarations into the chat box while praying!) 

Some things to consider: 
- Take some extra care to connect with the freshies this week and get them online for CG!
- You don't have to do >2h (it can get a bit draggy online, but breaking out to discuss in smaller online groups helps! Usually when they have the chance to talk among themselves first, it's easier for them to share w the group after~) 
- Use the chatgroup!! More answers, less time (get some of them to elaborate 😊)
[2/4/20, 12:11:17 AM] Rox SOUTH: From the JC leaders chat @6596931493 🥰👍
[2/4/20, 12:14:39 AM] Rox SOUTH: If you feel that you would like to go more in a fellowship direction here’s some suggested questions as we remember the cross this coming weekend!! :) instead of apostle doctrine!! 
1. What would my life look like if I didn’t have Jesus? 
2. What am I thankful to Jesus for for today?

[8/4/20, 9:53:53 PM] Rachel Lee ARROW SA: *JC Online Leaders Huddle*
8 April 2020 

Anchor verse: *Psalm 78:72*

_“guided” —> nachah_
Skilfulness of Hands - SOH
	1.	Connecting with them
	2.	Caring for the Flock
	•	Being present in their lives
	•	In the form of messages/ hospital visits, 
	3.	Collaborating
	•	Involving them with the CG (Engaging youths to serve)

_”hands” —> kaph_
Closeness in SOH
	1.	Slide into DMs
	•	Show them what God is doing in their lives, unlike their friends!
	2.	Remember key dates
	•	Helps with keeping them in prayer
	3.	Let there be “Zoom”
	•	Utilise this platform
	•	Watch sermons, have meals

Are there ways to make a big CG feel small?
How to make CG feel fun?
—> Give them a portion in the caregroup
—> Sharing/ taking charge

Genesis 43:34
Benjamin got a special portion
—> “Five times” = anointing and giftings

*5 Changes of Garments //*
*He has more anointing to give*

Going back to the anchor verse
What set David apart?
He had a different perspective

1 Samuel 17:28
David’s brother despised the sheep
VS
1 Samuel 17:34
David calls the sheep “my father’s sheep”

*Relationship with the Shepherd //*
*Faithfulness with the Flock*

	⁃	- - - - -  - 

*Psalm 23*

The demand is on the good shepherd to hold the flock together

“Shepherd” 
= ra’ah
= rash-ayin-hei
= head-eye-grace
 —> to be a shepherd is to be conscious of and to see grace

“He makes me to lie down”
Lying down in abundance 
= reliance on the Lord
= humility
Proverbs 20:20 —> dwelling of the righteous

It is the week of the Passion (T.T)

“paths of righteousness” is rounded
Picture of a continual upward journey with the Lord (like winding stairs!)
—> The top is called tiqvah, “hope”!
—> Every time we return to the Lord, we are justified by Him 

“prepare a table”
= “arat” to join in battle
—> In a battle, our part is to join with the Lord in battle! because He is in our battle
—> All we have to do is to SIT at the table and partake of the Lord; do not be removed from your dwelling place! Sit! 

The Lord is not surprised by our circumstances; He has gone before!
Look at the bread before you

“You anoint my head with oil,
My cup runs over”
Psalm 116 —> the cup of SALVATION
= “revayah” abundance!!!! the Lord wants to bring us to an unprecedented abundant life

“Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life. And I will dwell in the house of the LORD forever”
—> His promises again!!!!
—> Look at “dwell”


Sheep are typically reared for the benefit of the Shepherd (for wool, for milk etc), but in our case, the Shepherd is here for the benefit of the sheep; we have nothing to give but our “yes” leh 😭

The Lord is my Shepherd; one who would lay down His life for His sheep.......

[15/4/20, 8:14:25 PM] Vanessa: Any of your house’s internet down?
[15/4/20, 8:15:24 PM] Abel Khoo: quite a lot of ppl
[15/4/20, 8:16:10 PM] Abel Khoo: wifi icon on the top bar > open network preferences > advanced > DNS > click on the + sign, type in 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.8.4
[15/4/20, 8:16:10 PM] Abel Khoo: iPhone guide:

Settings > wifi > click the i on ur wifi > configure DNS > manual > replace with "8.8.8.8" and "8.8.4.4"

MacBook guide:

wifi icon on the top bar > open network preferences > advanced > DNS > click on the + sign, type in 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4 > ok and apply

Windows guide:

For windows laptop, open control panel > network and internet > network and sharing centre > change adapter settings > right click your wifi and press properties > select internet protocol version 4 and click properties > click “Use the following DNS server addresses“ > key in 8.8.8.8 for preferred DNS and 8.8.4.4 for alternate DNS > click ok and close
[15/4/20, 8:18:20 PM] Vanessa: Oh wow

[2/5/20, 10:55:32 PM] Rox SOUTH: Ni hao! Here’s a few updates on the plans for May Holiyays and some changes!

There are some administrative changes to the dates of Masterclasses/ CGs. These changes are to create a more integrated experience for the youths, and also to lighten the load on us as we build up momentum towards Legacy Reimagined :) 

Here's a *chronological* overview of the coming dates :) 
1⃣ *6 May* 2020 Huddle will be replaced by the Open Jio session (830-10pm) + look out for our JC leaders bible plan hehe 📖#WordLife#Thrivelife consequently, this will happen weekly: on 13, 20 May (same time) :tada:
2⃣ The M&W Meeting will be pushed back to 6 June (originally: 9 May) for now :+1:🏻 :sheep: Instead *9 May will become CG*. CGs are encouraged to just play, or to take some time to share testimonies or to just connect with one another.
3⃣ The Possessing our Possessions (Take your mountain) Masterclass is shifted to *16 May*  ⛰
4⃣ *23 May* 2020 will be normal CG (Following the Spirit CGM) :ocean: + Set "Camp" expectations together :) ** we will probably set aside some time as a cluster to meet as well! 
5⃣ Remember to be a sheep guys! :sheep::sheep::sheep:
In the meantime, let’s be prayed up and asking the Lord for the GMTM Spirit :) 
Thank you for running with us guys!! 🎊

Please reply with ⛰ when you’ve read! 🙂

[4/5/20, 9:50:04 PM] Rachel Lee ARROW SA: Hi guys, just wanna share two testimonies of healing that came in this week :,,,) 

*Testimony 1*
One of my youths invited a friend to watch the Good Friday service but she wasn’t very keen on it. This friend happened to be having some heart condition. 

During the Good Fri service, Pastor Dan called out healing for heart problems :,) so right after the 2.30 service ended, my youth called her friend to pray for her over the phone. The friend was very moved by the prayer and felt a sense of warmth over her. Because of that, she even decided to tune in for the 5.30 service! 

Since that week she’s gone in for multiple tests. Today the results from all 3 tests came back, and she has been cleared of the heart problem!! There have also been no more pain symptoms since then!! Completely healed!!!! Thank you Jesus 😭🙌🏻

*Testimony 2* 
On monday, another of my youth’s sister woke up with blurry vision and she couldnt see. Since she has had a medical history of this happening before (like it’s a legit medical condition, and she nearly went full blind at 22), they rushed her to the a&e. The doctors recommended an immediate surgery for both eyes the very next day :,,) 

15 minutes before the op, my youth felt the led by the Holy Spirit to pray for the sister. The sister cried and felt a sense of warmth and calmness rush over her! 

In the end the surgery went well and she’s recovering well now too :)

Even so, am believing for the sister for full healing from this condition!!! And that it cannot return in the name of Jesus. 🙌🏻🔥

[5/5/20, 4:29:59 PM] Berwin ARROW: HELLO ARROW FAM:) 

Here’s to another edition of closed door bible study for this week! We’ll be diving into Nehemiah TODAY at 5PM! We will be spending time for the next few days thinking about LEADERSHIP from this book:)

[5/5/20, 8:19:56 PM] Rachel Lee ARROW SA: Hi guys, gonna share my one thought from the leaders reading :) 

Pastor always says there iz significance in the names so that’s where i started :,) HAHAH i went to see what the names of the 12 spies in Numbers 13 meant. 

It’s a bit long so i will only talk about Caleb and Joshua, but if you look through the names, they seem to reveal the gospel :,)

_Caleb_ - dog 
_Hoshea_ - salvation, renamed _Joshua_ - *Jehovah is* salvation
The difference is in the Hebrew; God added two additional letters “yud” and “vav”, representing “hand” and “nail”

“Dog” reminded me of the woman in Matthew 15/ Mark 7, and how the gentiles are referred to as “puppies”

I know Caleb and Joshua represent the new generation. After studying it again this time, i feel like i see the new covenant here too :,)

By the death of Jesus (*His nail-pierced hands*), all have been bought back by the blood, redeemed and made righteous! Jews and *gentiles* alike now have *access to the promise land*! And this is the promise we get to walk in yeyyy what a God we have :,)

[5/5/20, 8:35:07 PM] Rachel Lee ARROW SA: A side nugget!!!

In Joshua 14, Caleb asks to possess Mt. Hebron, which he ended up inheriting :,) “Hebron” means to unite or bind together (like a marriage covenant)/ fellowship :,) 

So when Caleb inherited Mt Hebron, iz like saying the gentiles inherited fellowship. Our inheritance is a covenant with God (or more of God’s covenant with us HAHHA) :,)

[6/5/20, 2:30:45 PM] Megan ARROW: Hi hi so sorry I was really busy ystd and completely forgot about this until late last night when I finally checked my texts :") So sending mine today!! (Is a very short thought!!)

In v27 when the spies were coming back from the land they said 'We went to the land where *you* sent us', they didn't see it as the Lord sending them but probably saw it as instructions from man to do so, hence the perspective they gave about the land was more in the natural sense.

*Perspective changes things!* Looking at things in the natural and viewing it from man's perspective can often lead to fear and in this case they ended up in the wilderness for 40 years and the other 10 spies died also. But when we view things from the Lord's perspective, fear has no hold on you and also gives you an expectant heart with faith for whats to come!

in numbers 14 when caleb & joshua were speaking and said if the Lord delights in us.... the word delight _[chaphets]_ is also the same word is isaiah 53:10 where it says it _pleased_ the Lord to bruise Him

[14/5/20, 9:01:36 PM] Vanessa: Hi everyone, it’s my turn to share what I caught from this week’s bible study on the book of Joshua! I’ll be sharing from Joshua 15:13&14. 

Context: Joshua had just given Hebron to Caleb & Caleb proceeded to drive out 3 groups of Anakites -- the descendants of Sheshai, Ahiman & Talmai, the sons of Anak. 

I found it really interesting that the bible would specifically name these 3 groups of Anaks so I decided to dig more. 

What I found is!!!! On surface level, these 3 names + “anak” seem q alright, really q mild/non-threatening. Off the bat, they seem q good also (ie my first thought was wow! They lowkey sound like traits of Christ): 

1. Sheshai - noble, mercy
2. Ahiman - my brother is a gift, brother of the right hand
3. Talmai: furrowed/plowman/abounding in furrows.
4. Anal: neck 

BUT on deeper study on the rootwords, these are the meanings:

1. Sheshai - to bleach, whiten. 
--Sounds almost like making clean right? Like how Jesus’ blood washes us clean. But when I thought abt it and asked the Lord, I decided to search the implications of using bleach to clean, and it is HORRIBLE for your skin. It is super toxic. It is really just eroding and not cleaning at all. 

2. Ahiman - of resemblance, half-brother ie same father, each to the other ie a reciprocal relationship. 
-- how I saw this was it bringing the law/ mix of law&grace into the picture. Firstly, if u did not know the truth of God, the law/rules/regulations etc really seem to “resemble” the nature of God because that is what religion is. Secondly, if 2 half brothers have the same father, then it means they have diff mothers (I saw these mothers as law & grace). And thirdly, reciprocal relationship really just screams of the “do good get good, do bad get beat” principle of the law. 

3. Talmai - Mark or be marked with lines or wrinkles caused by frowning, anxiety, or concentration. Which imo is a picture of self-works & effort. 

4. Anak - Strong’s definition of the root word is to choke, the root word etymology is “a necklace (as if strangling): chain”. 
-- speaks of bondage 

But Caleb drove these things out when he inherited Hebron ie when he was in association/fellowship w God!!!!! 

And that is our portion today too! That when you are in fellowship w God, when you know His delight and love towards you, you are 1. Made completely and wholly pure, 2. Completely under grace, 3. Redeemed from self-work/effort. You are free from bondage!!!

The Lord is so good!!!

[15/5/20, 3:51:27 AM] Rox SOUTH: Mine’s a simple thought hehe!  (A few days overdue :”))
I went to search up the Hebrew of “wholly followed” since it was what defined Caleb!!

Followed - is achar; and the thing that surprised me was it’s first mention (and many other mentions) were genealogy-related. Specifically, the “after” of fathering. Blb also cross referenced to Genesis 22:13 about the ram that was behind Abraham that was stuck in the thicket (Debs also mentioned this) which eventually became the sacrifice instead of Isaac to the Lord. 

🤩 Thought 1a: Following the Lord comes by knowing your identity as son/daughter, of knowing your good, good Father’s heart towards you. 

🌟Thought 1b: Following the Lord may seem difficult because it may seem like it costs us much (45 years of wandering for Caleb, Abraham almost sacrificed his son) but I really love the ram which is a picture of grace and mercy, Jesus as the ultimate sacrifice... that for us, today, ‘forsaking all’ to follow the Lord then is not the sum of all our cost, but really that none can compare to the price of the cross. 

Wholly- is male; which is “to fill; as anything does to a vacant space with abundance” (blb)

🇸🇬 Thought 2: An all-consuming understanding of the Lord’s love (delight) produces a divine contentment- where all our need is satisfied in Him. Following the Lord produces a full, overflowing heart that leaves no space for lack to remain! 

Different (in Numbers 14:24 Different Spirit): is archer and also means a “following” spirit. It’s root word is also the same one as “followed” which talks about delay and waiting. 

🔥 Thought 3: A different spirit is a following spirit. A spirit that follows the Lord and the faithfulness of His word and promise. 
 
this “different” is mentioned in a number of verses... there’s Noah who while wating sends out a dove, there’s Jacob who serves Laban for 7 more years to be with Rachel... and interestingly though the root word (same as following) of this “different” is delay... the verses highlighted are about the Lord not delaying and His promises  coming to past in His appointed time (Hab 2:3) 

🌈Thought 4: a following spirit sees above the delay to see the loving nature of the Lord! That’s what encourages longevity in ministry, and perseverance  in our walk with the Lord: hope in a God who never disappoints.

[15/5/20, 4:57:34 PM] Joelle ARROW CJ: oh yes sorry!!! haha slipped my mind

but i think something that stood out for me was numbers 15:16
And Caleb said, "He who attacks Kirjath Sepher and takes it, to him I will give Achsah my daughter as wife"
I love how Caleb as a leader, not only did he have a spirit of boldness, but he also encouraged those under him to be equally as bold and just like what darren shared it was because he was so grounded in the promise of God (wholly following the Lord). And i think it sets a really good example of what kind of leadership we carry towards our youths. That its not just ask taking bold steps of faith but also encouraging our youths to be equally as bold and most importantly reminding them that boldness can only stem from knowing that the Lord is faithful to his promises.

And i also love how his daughter asked boldly "Give me a blessing, since you have given me land..." and how like a good leader's boldness (Caleb) rubs off his descendants and offspring, that as leaders when your youths see your boldness and your faith in the Lord because of his faithfulness, they would be inclined to imitate and carry that same spirit of boldness and faith:D
